Reviews.Title: “Fair Fenwick”
Reviews.Author: CDNGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: The Fenwick Inn, located on the Ocean City main strip at the far north end of the city, has a lot of potential. The room was large, and given a top floor stay, had a spectacular view of the ocean. The structure is solid, but the overall hotel appears to be falling short of repair. The room was clean, but you can detect it is falling apart. For the price and location, if you want to stay in Ocean City, but not anywhere near the hubbub, the Fenwick Inn is a great choice. With only a few minutes walk to the beach, one can catch an early morning sunrise or enjoy a day at the beach without straying too far from their room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: pos190
Reviews.Content: Super last-minute weekend stay, needed something fast. Stayed at Fenwick (Far from boardwalk, hotel is around 130th, Boardwark starts at 30th) Saturday/Sunday night for Labor Day. A little pricey for 2 nights (~$400), but the place was clean, spacious, and relaxing. Bathrooms were clean, no stains or broken fixtures. Shower was hot but could have used some more pressure. Plenty of soaps/shampoos/towels etc. Room (King) was good size, comfy bed, fold out couch, fridge, microwave, dated TV but good selection of channels. A/C was COLD and not too loud. Cleaned room by 10:30. Pool looked good, property seemed clean overall. WiFi only available in lobby. Check-in @ 4:00, only took a few minutes, and the desk employee was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Last Splash of Summer”
Reviews.Author: George S
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Inn. We had 3 king size rooms for our family. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Bus stop was right outside the hotel door, loved that. Staff was very nice and well versed on places around the Inn, on what to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Fenwick Fling Package”
Reviews.Author: leeandtee
Reviews.Content: We recently booked the Fenwick Fling, a 3 night stay at the Fenwick Inn, Ocean City Md. Aug. 26 thru 29. With the Fling you get the 3 weeknights, $12 daily breakfast coupon, and a $40 voucher for dinner of your choice at 10 different (pre-chosen) restaurants. Now the Review The room was very nice, very clean and comfy. We got the king bed room, huge comfy bed (but take your own pillow) a sofa and a desk with mini fridge and microwave. Room faced Bayside, no view but we didnt look out the window much. Nice stong shower, plenty of towels. Breakfast was limited choices but ok for a quickie breakfast. With the copon you'll kick in $8 to $10 for two for breakfast and that includes tip. We got to the beach early every day thanks to just taking the elevator upstairs to eat. The upstairs lounge was was nice we had good happy hour prices and a great bartender (Alex) The pool is nice water was ok, overclorinated but most indoor pools are. Its open until 10pm which was nice after hitting some happy hours and coming back for a late swim. For the dinner voucher we chose one of the buffet places for our dinner but thats a different review. The voucher cut our dinner cost by 2/3s with tip so it was a real value. All in all if you can book the Fenwick Fling you cant go wrong. The hotel is older, but nice and clean, and friendly people, and service. We paid $250 for what is esentially still prime time in OCMD and we got breakfast daily and dinner one night. Also included when you book at the Fenwick Inn site you get to choose 5 or 6 coupons for places like the Green Turtle, Smitty's, and many more vouchers. We didnt even use all of our vouchers. We will be booking this package again. For OCMD prices its just about unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was clean and perfect”
Reviews.Author: beachgrle1
Reviews.Content: Ok so I just stayed here at this hotel, the room was clean, bathroom was clean no yellow stains in the tub or sink, they both were very clean, the bathroom floor was clean, clean bedsheets and nice size room. front check in service was a breeze, the staff was nice, pool and hot tub was nice. I had no problems at all, during my stay the maid left towels in a nice bag outside of my room for extra towels if needed. I just do not know why people like to complain about this hotel, you ARE on vacation of course there will be little complaints everyone will complain about but please keep in mind this is no hilton so stop your complaining about minor things and deal with it. Like I said when I was there every other guests said they had a fun time and the hotel was nice and clean. great location and not in the heart of all the loudness and fuss going on downtown OC.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip!”
Reviews.Author: jared G
Reviews.Content: Before i go on a trip I always read the reviews and usaully get mixed reviews. When I arrived at the Hotel the front desk personnel were very friendly, and it was very quick and easy to check in. When I got to the room it was very clean and comfortable. it was affordable and close enough to all the attractions in town. i would definilty stay here again and would recommend it to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Stephanieeeh
Reviews.Content: Before going I read the reviews and got all mixed reviews(most bad) when we got there the front desk staff was very nice. The hotel room we had was 417 with a king bed. The floors could be shampooed a little more often but I am 19 and I could cre less. Anyway the location was perfect close to everything and far from major boardwalk traffic. There really wasn't anything I would complain about. I think people only go on to write reviews when they have a bad experience but I had a great 2 day trip and I will DEFINATLY 100% go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tami H
Reviews.Content: I read mixed reviews before booking and was surprised upon checking in. Front desk personnel in the morning/early afternoon rude however, the rest of the front desk personnel were awesome. We requested the 5th floor which are the recently renovated rooms. Our room was clean, updated and the beds comfortable. The pool area is in bad need of updating but it served its purpose and was clean and fun for the kids. Maid staff very nice and did a great job. The hotel, for the most part, was clean however, not a deep cleaning but presentable. We did not utilize the top floor restaurant/bar area so can not give my impression. For the most part, this hotel was in a great location to the beach, bus and general activities so I give that 100%. Cleanliness of hotel I give 40%. Front Desk AM/early afternoon staff 20%. Maid staff I give 100%. Updated facilities I give 50%. This hotel served its purpose for us however we probably would not stay again because at a room rate of $269.00 per night we expect a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Dorian B
Reviews.Content: I read reviews for the Fenwick Inn before arriving. They were mixed so I became a little leary.When we arrived the front desk staff was very friendly. When we got our room it was clean. We loved the location as we were able to take a short walk to the beach.We did have some minor issues with the bathrooms cleanliness(dust) Staff was very timely in addressing this. The minor issues weren't deal breakers . I met a couple that has been staying ata The Fenwick Inn every year for ten years.No, the Fenwick Inn is not plush like a Marriott or a Hilton. No it is not a dump either. It is well kept and, in an ideal location. It is not overpriced like many other hotels in the area( If you book online you get great money saving vouchers). Overall The fenwick Inn is an Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Aronya
Reviews.Content: This is our choice in OC. Quiet area, short walk to the beach. In the past - service in the restaurant has been great -- but this go around it was terrible. Waiter was new, no support for him, didn't know anything on the menu, took everyones order but forgot to bring two of the entrees. Didn't get silverware to after the missing entrees were brought. The manager was proactive in only charging us for 1/2 the bill, but it still made for an unpleasant experience. Has fridge and microwave. Definately ask for a veiw. Firework show from hotel room was great for the kids. Great weather so didn't use the pool this go around -- it's typically really crowded and not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “"You get what you pay for "”
Reviews.Author: Ladi25
Reviews.Content: The place need to be torn down remodel. Just make sure you are prepared for unclean stay .The rooms reeks with odor ,good thinking on my part I brung Lysol,renuzit air freshners and cleaning desinfect. The staff were friendly . If you are poor this is the place to stay .I should have followed my brother he stayed at the Hamptons. 8-5-2012 .

Reviews.Title: “Not getting Value for my money”
Reviews.Author: reallylikes2travel
Reviews.Content: Indoor pool was packed, the air con was noisy, our room given to us was facing on the parking lot, etc. The good thing is the hotel is a walking distance to the beach - best point. Always find a car parking spot at the hotel. I was suspicious though, as it is open (not gated), that the car park was being used by the non-hotel guests. I wasn't feeling secured with two kids n spouse.

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable”
Reviews.Author: LindaNewHolland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice even tho old, the staff are nice, the indoor pool is good, it does need some ventilation in there tho.. We would stay here the last week in june every year until this year when the price tripled, not sure why cause there not offering anything new. its about one block from the beach, it's easy to walk across coastal highway, it is a high rise so you get no balconies. All in all tho the room is clean, bathrooms are nice, elevator is not slow...it's pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay...”
Reviews.Author: P C
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Fenwick Inn and I had a good experience. Clean rooms, friendly staff, free coffee in the mornings, microwave & fridge in the room, close to the beach and restaurants. I booked online, which allows you to choose vouchers for activities and places to eat. The pool and hot tub were nice. One downside was the pillow cases. I had to ask for fresh ones, as the ones on the bed upon my arrival were not clean. I had a minor issue with the cable TV connection. I called the front desk and maintenance came up and fixed it in less than 15 minutes. The outside of the building is a bit dated, but the cleanliness of the rooms, friendliness of the staff, amenities and convenient location make up for that. I would've given it four stars if not for the above issues. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sally S
Reviews.Content: Despite a snafu in the arrangements with Expedia, the staff at Fenwick (Charles, Jenna, Christy and Donna) went out of their way to make sure they honored our reservation. They gave us the last available room, a two room suite - wet bar, flat screen TV, pull-out soft and a down blanket on the VERY comfortable bed. Our room was clean, well tended and just GREAT. We couldn't have had a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: petty768
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Wi'll stay every year. The hotel is older by up to date. It has everything you will need. Staff is friendly and welcoming. Clean rooms wonderful location. Indoor pool was fantastic. Thank you for another great year!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad”
Reviews.Author: A H
Reviews.Content: It was the first and the last stay at Fenwick Inn! NEVER AGAIN!!! Hotel is dirty, all furniture is worn out, stained, chipped, nasty... I took some pictures, so you can see it yourself, but I forgot to take a picture of the cigaret burn on the blanket. (The pictures were taking at the second room, the first room was even worse.) We even didn't try to go to the pool and restaurant... The only good thing about this hotel is location. Very close to the beach( about 3 min to walk).

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience for a Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Keem27
Reviews.Content: We booked here as it was close to the location where I stayed growing up. The staff in the lobby was very nice - very useful, friendly. They told us to check out the room before we checked in to make sure we were ok with everything. Pros: Spacious room, great location, refrigerator in room, cleaned on time every day. Cons: Lumpy bed (not great for sleep), room faced the parking lot, bathtub didn't drain properly, there was wireless internet only in lobby. All in all, not too bad for the value. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but within walking distance to Ocean”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr313
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years in a row to be within walking distance to my family staying at a nearby condo. The restaurant on the top floor is nice to people watch everyone going down coastal highway. Staff is nice, but management can be a little stuck up. The rooms are just okay. Cleanliness is also just okay... It meets "beach" average standards. Might go again to be convenient to the family in the future. Trying something different this year.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous330
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fenwick Inn because we thought we were getting a good deal. The hotel staff are pretty clueless, check in was a disaster, the pool was NASTY and cloudy. The pictures on the website are very deceiving! The restaurant on the 8th floor is a joke. They serve a very limited menu, and then don't have items available on their menu. The prices are outrageous and the manager is a young, unprofessional kid who tried to offer us a free breakfast the next day for our horrible dinner, but a breakfast that is advertised all over the hotel from 8am-11am, ran out of food before 10am and had to stop serving breakfast before we arrived. We have been going to Ocean City, MD for over 10 years now and have never had such a terrible trip. We will NEVER go back and I will make sure everyone I talk to avoids this place as well. Ruined a much anticipated and much needed vacation week. With all the wonderful other options in Ocean City, please don't ever stay here..even if it looks like a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Read before you book”
Reviews.Author: Terry E
Reviews.Content: Booked for two night 7/20 and 7/21. First impression upon entering, yuck! Entrance was filthy, lobby was filthy, lobby sitting area rug had huge stain, furniture was filthy, pool was at end of lobby, smelled like soiled diaper, check in was great I guess they went fast so you wouldn't look around, stayed on 6th floor, room was ok, walls very thin, windows too, you could hear every car, ac was loud, you could hear the music coming from the lounge on the 8th floor, had to car front desk twice for inconsiderate guest allowing toddlers and kids to run the hall until 1130 pm, front desk was nice and did take care of it on second call but music continued from the bar, nothing like ac/dc highway to he'll when you are trying to sleep. Front desk tried to locate another room but only thing available wax on same floor, bathroom door wood splintered at bottom. I couldn't stay here another night so we left after 1night. 1star hotel not for me, sorry

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CostasDaGreek
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Fenwick inn for the week of July 4 because every other hotel was booked for that week. Check in was fine, friendly service and all. Unfortunately we were on the seventh floor which was right under the bar which is opened until 2 am. As soon as we got off the elevator our floor had a very nasty odor and it smelled like cigarettes. The room was fine, certainly not for what we paid but for a couple nights it was fine. I saw small insects in the room but I didn't make a big deal out of it. No one could sleep at night because the loud noise coming from the bar which was consistent until 2 am. Very disappointing especially since they refused to give us a discount. I have been to many hotels in ocean city and while I'm sure there are far worse, I guarantee I wont be back here. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Went downhill”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fenwick Inn and were not impressed. We have stayed there previously and was always pleased except for this time. The place is very outdated. The toilet didnt' flush properly, the shower head didn't work properly, the cable wire came out of the television, and I contacted the front desk and was told that maintenance would come, they did not show up. The light in the bathroom didn't work ery well either. The tile behind the toilet was falling apart. I do not think we will be staying there again. Such a shame because the location was great and usually cheaper than most hotels but I guess you get what you pay for. It could be a great place again but needs to be renovated and kept up with.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, it's ok...”
Reviews.Author: Gina J
Reviews.Content: It was old and dated and just very basic. No great decor ... the place needs a modern boost. ...but they do have very reasonable weekend specials and the location is fantastic. It's near some of my favorite OC/Fenwick restaurants, the beach across the street is huge and gorgeous (my ex proposed to me on the beautiful north Ocean City/Fenwick sunny beach with the waves crashing in the background.) ... and there is a great little Greek diner right across the street for breakfast. Granted ... I have not been there since a romantic weekend in April of 2005, where I stayed for a weekend and my ex proposed to me ... but from what I have heard from other people too, the Fenwick Inn NEVER changes. ...and maybe that's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “All Good Things must come to an End.”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at this Hotel for the past 30 years. The Last Two Years it has taken a downward spiral. The Front Desk Personel are rude and unfriendly,The room smelled like Urine (I'm not kidding),There was a hole in Our room curtain that was there when we stayed last spring,The Two Wall lights where the beds are were burnt out and Our clock radio was broken. I mean this is pathetic. This Hotel held a place in Our hearts for years and now they have let it go to sh*t almost overnight. The General Manager and Corporate office (if they have one) should be ashamed of what has happened to The Fenwick Inn but I guess they don't give a sh*t either. Sad to Say End of an Era. We won't be Back.

Reviews.Title: “Honoring Your Contractural Obligations - FAIL FAIL FAIL”
Reviews.Author: StarvingArtist
Reviews.Content: I was in Ocean City Maryland during June 15-17, 2012 participating in the Arts Alive event. Friday the 15th was set-up day. After a tiring friday beach traffic drive and exhibit set-up, my wife and I set off to the Fenwick Inn to check in. I had made reservations in February and was expecting to get the rate negotiated between the Fenwick Inn and my hotel room broker (a large national service which supplies discount lodging sevices across the US and also to various Federal, State, and Local government agencies). The rate I was expecting to pay is approximately one half the normal in-season room rate. This rate is secured under contract between the hotel and my lodging service. The lodging service does not show any blackout dates or caveats. When I arrived at the hotel, the lobby was jammed with noisy softball tournament participants and their parents/chaperones. The lobby desk staff were working as fast as they could and included the Manager on Duty - Ch___les. It was he whom I dealt with at check in time. When I presented him with my reservation confirmation and the account card the lodging service provides to be presented upon check in and required by participating hotels, he indicated that he would not be able to honor my rate under the contract between the Fenwick Inn and the lodging service. I was taken aback. I was over 100 miles from home and there were no other hotels which participated in this lodging service. I mentioned my reservations made in February and confirmed in May. The Manager on Duty said he was under instructions from the hotel manager to not honor the contracted rate due to some disagreement with the lodging service. I called the lodging service 1-800 number to speak to a representative. They indicated that the facility was under contract and that they did not show any blackout dates. They confirmed what my rate was supposed to be and offered to call the hotel to try to get us a room for that evening at the contracted rate. They promised to call back. Fifteen minutes later, they called back. Long and Short: The hotel manager on duty (whom I had already received a 'no' from) also told the lodging service that the hotel would not honor their contracted rate. I asked for a supervisor and got one. I explained the situation to her and she also called the hotel. The manager on duty apparently called the general manager at home during this time. After the lodging service supervisor spoke with the manager on duty, I received a call back from her. Long and Short: No Dice..... The lodging service supervisor was unable to help me out and said that their contract administration dept would take up the matter on the following Monday. Meanwhile, my wife and I are S-O-L. The closest participating hotel was 25 miles away. We were stuck in a resort town on a friday night with no reservations and hotels which were charging premium rates because they were more than 80% full.... The Fenwick Inn manager on duty was discussing his discomfort with others behind the counter loudly enough to hear and remarked his displeasure with having to be the 'bad guy'. My wife and I were thoroughly disgusted at this point with the Fenwick Inn and their failure to honor their committments. As we were departing their lobby, the manager made a weak, lame, half-hearted apology as were were at the door from behine the counter. At that point, my wife suggested if the Fenwick Inn truly had a problem with the lodging service and their contract/billing/payments, that the obvious solution was to take the matter up with the company and not to ding the customer. It was not our fault that their firm was unhappy with the firm providing their lodging services to us. They should have immediately realized that they were going to seeing reviews like this and complaints to the Mayor's Office, Better Business Bureau and anyone else who might be able to impress upon the Fenwick Inn management that being in the hospitality industry requires hospitable behavior. My theory is that the management of the Fenwick Inn was trying to make a buck by denying us a room at a cheap contracted rate and then sticking it to a walk in whio would have to pay inflated room rates because the hotel was near full....

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for... or maybe not!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelenfool
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the fenwick inn and was surprised at how outdated the pictures are on their website. Originally we booked 1 night and decided to stay another night, the rate that was quoted us for the second night, was not the price that was billed, I have been trying to get this straightened out for a few days, with not much luck. This hotel is very old and worn down. However, the Rooms were clean but in desperate need of renovation. The pool was pretty cloudy, so we didn't attempt to swim in it. We went to the Skyline Restaurant and Bar on the 8th floor and found it to be pretty gross, and very seedy looking. All and all we didn't let the place ruin out trip but wish we would have just paid upfront for a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “downhill slide”
Reviews.Author: queban
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fenwick Inn several times in the past couple of years. Well, this time was the worst. The room was smelly, matress had brown stains on the side (no bed skirt), sheets and blanket had cigarette holes in them. The bedspread was nasty too.. The staff are a bit rude when dealing with complaints; however, I guess that's not surprising considering how many they probably get each day....very disappointing. There are other spots in the same price range or cheaper...I would check out their reviews and book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Nice”
Reviews.Author: JAZ784
Reviews.Content: The staff was always very polite and helpful. They gave great directions and suggestions on things to do. My son loved the pool and my husband loved going upstairs for breakfast while we slept in. Being so close to Delaware, it was very easy to spend time in Bethany Beach. We will certainly recommend the Fenwick Inn to our friends and will plan a return trip for us. JAZ

Reviews.Title: “Greg ( General Manager) is the BEST!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharboogie
Reviews.Content: I had an issue regarding a cancellation and Greg and his staff were more than helpful resolving the issue. Moreover, I LOVE Fenwick Inn... Great Prices, Great Service, Great People!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Leonard W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. They made you feel at home. We are in our 50's and the hotel had a lot of young people there when we were there. But we never knew it. they kept everything under control. The house keeping did a great job of keeping towels in the room and clean sheets on the bed. would recommend this motel to visitors of all ages. They will make you smile.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy place at the beach”
Reviews.Author: Justretired48
Reviews.Content: First impression in the Lobby was not great but upon entering the room we were pleased. It was clean, large with a comfortable bed and plenty of pillows. Nice sofa and table and chairs, small frig and microwave. Bathroom a little sad but clean. I'm sure these rooms take a lot of abuse over the summer. Across the street from the ocean, which we could see from our room. No wifi and only free coffee for breakfast. Indoor pool. The seemed to be remodeling but did not hear any noise.

Reviews.Title: “worth what I paid”
Reviews.Author: pearlbalt
Reviews.Content: The Fenwick Inn is presently remodeling many of its rooms. Even so, when we needed a room change due to a noise issue, the staff was glad to oblige and offered us a change immediately. I would go back, but next time I would insist on a room not facing the ocean/street. The view was lovely, but the noise from the Coastal Highway was too loud and close. Give me quiet, I'll skip the view. Overall, though, the place was clean, comfortable and friendly, despite the worn look of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for cheap thrills”
Reviews.Author: Simply S
Reviews.Content: Small indoor "water park", but entertaining for toddler age. Room was large and good enough for what we paid. Restaurant needs a visit from Robert Irvine, but wait staff made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “decent place for the money.”
Reviews.Author: CroonerFairfax
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fenwick Inn as we have on several occasions, and once again for the price it was very reasonable. They offer rooms where you can bring your pets which we don't but have never had an unpleasant experience.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Mid Atlantic I am always traveling
Reviews.Title: “Fenwick inn needs a new restaurant and lounge.”
Reviews.Author: AlexisAndersonxx
Reviews.Content: The Room was mediocre and needs remodeling. Seems like it has been a long time since it has been remodeled. Outside of the hotel looked shabby. The hot tub was nice. The restaurant was terrible and can't make a burger and fries. There wings made me sick. I should have gone to the ER. If you stay there avoid the restaurant and bar. The bartender did nothing but look down my shirt. It was like he had never seen boobs before.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, not smoke free”
Reviews.Author: DAM_TROLLS
Reviews.Content: Have been here many times, but this time the room smelled very strongly of cigarette smoke. For a room that is clearly listed as non-smoking, it heavily smelled of smoke. Even as we came down the hall later in the evening people were still smoking in their rooms. Owners should enforce the no smoking policy better. Still affordable with nice king size beds.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Stay”
Reviews.Author: Betty G
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Fenwick Inn a number of times over the years. The room we had had just recently had been updated with new bed linens, carpet and drapes but the bathroom was in real need of updating. There was no hair dryer which seems to be the norm now days, no frills. There was no coffee pot in the room but coffee was available in the lobby. The hallways and elevator lobbies need to be updated. The price was great, not a bad place to stay and convenient to the beach and lots of things close by. Would stay at the Fenwick again.

Reviews.Title: “dont listen to nay sayers-been going for years and never saw or experienced other reviews”
Reviews.Author: watchronski
Reviews.Content: during my recent stay(one ofd very many) i now realize how shameful our society has become. I witnessed staff members being needlessly treated so horrible-noone should speak that way to another human being. To their credit the staff took it it graciously. I would highly reccomend:)

Reviews.Title: “Say "no"-even if it is a great $ deal!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was disappointing. Heard for years, when I was a kid, how posh the Fenwick was-that was in the good ole' days-no longer even close to posh! My husband and I have not had a vacation in 4 years-due to a sick child and a sick father. We so needed a break-both of us work 2 jobs. The room was small, not as clean as I would have liked-no hair dryer-no fan in the bathroom. Pillows were so uncomfortable-no support at all...mushy and squishy. Our first night I was awokened by other guests banging on the doors and yelling down the hallway. The second night(about 1230am)-customers from the bar(upstairs in Fenwick) were in parking lot-drinking out of plastic cups-arguing...screaming....pushing each other...5 floors below us! We could hear everything clearly.The night time front desk clerk attempted to get the crowd of 10/12 to leave with no luck. Hotel has no security at all-one girl-who we were told did not want to call the police and get the bar patrons in trouble. The bar patrons were beyond drunk and one car drove through the red light fast when leaving the lot! The other car, van, kept having the alarm go off...numerous times at 1am in the morning! About 8 people who were drunk after making noise and disturbing the peace finally left-driving through the parking lot-obviously drunk. I called down to the front desk in the middle of this disturbance and asked the front desk lady, how long she was going to let this continue? She was no help at all! I told the front desk crew at check out in the morning-they could have cared less. The young man who worked the front desk the first day of our check in-seemed to be the only employee who actually cared about us and the service! Our first night-we decided to visit the bar upstairs. We were looking forward to the "happy hour" the website offered so wonderfully. The bartender upon arrival was "weeded" with 5 customers sitting at the bar. We waited a very long time when waiting to be served. We then asked for a menu-which we never got from him-but he seemed to get others around us a menu. The relief bartender came in-apparently late to his shift and seemed to care less about service than the first bartender. We asked for a menu and if they had any food specials....we were told "shrimp"...with a gruff and giggle. What kind of shrimp? No explantation...no nothing! The couple behind us also got sick of waiting for service and left. My husband and I felt slightly relieved that it was not us personally that were being ignored! We never got asked if we wanted to order food...so we quickly finished our drink...and left! We stopped at the front desk and told the very nice young man who was working earlier our issue-he did not seem shocked at our lousy service. We then went and ate across the street at LEOS! COMPLETELY not even worth the 98 buck special we were given. TOTally disappointed in the lack of cleanliness....professionalism etc. The icing on the cake was that the maid ran over my IPOD charger with the vacumn...ruining it-while were out for the day. The pool was dirty...hot tub had loose hair floating all over the hot tub. What in the world is going on at the FENWICK?

Reviews.Title: “Gross !!!!”
Reviews.Author: cal202
Reviews.Content: We thought we were staying at a pet friendly hotel not one that smelled like a 1,000 dogs had used it as their personal bathroon. The room was so disgusting that we wouldn't even take off our shoes or let the pup on the floor. We checked in well after midnight and checked out by 7am ! I would have been happy to sleep on the beach !! If that wasn't enough we had perfect timing at check in because that's when all the partiers from the top floor lounge are trying to come down the elevator....fighting, drunk and very very loud !! Heed the review warnings and NEVER step foot in this place !!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Lucie S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice during last month. First time it was OK. Had to ask for a different room as the first one I got had no wifi reception, also the first one smelled bad. My second stay was bad. Came in late, was tired so went to sleep right away. Woke up early and not rested at all. The room smelled of smoke (was a non smoking room), the sheets were not really clean etc. Also again there was no internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good cleaning.”
Reviews.Author: lab12345
Reviews.Content: Dog friendly is appropriate, the facilities couldnt get much dirtier. Torn curtains, dirt everywhere, ripping wallpaper and broken locks. The plus is that it is in a decent neighborhood and close to the beach for the dogs to walk and play. However i would not stay here again without seeing some serious improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Almost spring getaway”
Reviews.Author: tcvball
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Fenwick for over 5 years, usually twice a year -both off season. The hotel is not a 5 star, but it is always very clean and the staff will go out of their way to make you visit a pleasant one. We have always had a great mini-vacation there and plan to have many more in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was wonderful and rooms nice”
Reviews.Author: eski1
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in one of their beautiful suites. The pool was great and the front desk was very helpful and nice. Will definitely book with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms recently redone”
Reviews.Author: Teeny42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a weekend get-away in the middle of winter. King-suite was gorgeous with lovely kitchenette, sofa/tv area, and HUGE master bathroom with a lovely jacuzzi tub. Bed was super comfy and they didn't skimp on blankets/pillows either! The room was clean and the staff was friendly. It's right down the road from a grocery store, which was handy if you don't want to eat out the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Pool for Kids”
Reviews.Author: Gus1965
Reviews.Content: My two young sons and I visited the Fenwick Inn for one night to give the kids a chance to play in the pool in mid-winter. The hotel is a basic place with average rooms and it is also very reasonably priced ($49 weekday/$79 weekend). The pool is nothing really special, but it is larger than the average postage stamp indoor hotel pool and the kids had a great time. There is a bar on the 8th floor that looked good, but I was with the kids and did not have a chance to check it out during business hours. They also accept dogs for $10 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Nice pool and hut tub room was clean bathroom was clean”
Reviews.Author: beachgrle1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during December 2011 and I must say everything was clean and nice. The pool and hot tub was very nice, they did take down the water attraction they had inside the pool area, it was a mushroom lookalike that had water coming out. The room was very clean and the bathroom was clean also. I must say there was no holes in the ceiling in the bathroom or room because I have seen that at other motels and even hotels in Ocean City before. I can say the shower was very clean no mildew or nasty stains as I seen before in previous hotels/motels but then again it could only be in our room that was so clean at the hotel. I did see minor water damage on the walls and along the base board of the room but you gotta take the good with the bad and that was just a minor I can over see while staying at places in Ocean City, And I have stayed worst at other places with much more cosmetic damaged to the rooms like water and mildew smells in the room. This is my honest opnion and I will be coming back in August 2012 to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: AutumnKat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fenwick Inn for Thanksgiving. We got a great deal. $66 per night and this included dinner for two at their buffet on Thanksgiving and $12 vouchers for breakfast. The room was clean. They could use a bit of updating especially the windows could use some draft protection and I wish there was a vent in the bathroom and a guest laundry. We had some issues with the tv remote working properly and our door key but nothing serious was wrong with the room. The pool was great. Our son loved it and wanted to go in it every night. The pool does get full and so does the hot tub but there was room and lots of tables and chairs. The last night we stayed there the hotel was having a problem with the fire alarms and they went off three times. On the second time a customer expressed his concerns and the two ladies at the front desk did not handle it well and were rude. They kept telling us everything was ok, it was just a short in the wiring in the kitchen but that didn't sound safe and the complaining customer said he was going to call the fire marshall. Our son was upset and scared about the fire alarms going off and wanted to leave that evening. It is my understanding that the fire marshall did show up and the alarms did not go off the rest of the evening. The restaurant at the hotel had issues. They seemed understaffed and just not sure what they were doing. We were told at check inn that we should have been called to make reservation for dinner but we were not so we got in for dinner at 7 p.m. The buffet was not impressive and the service was no better. Our waiter was friendly but lacked the knowledge a waiter needs to serve...he didn't even bring us silverware and we couldn't get soda because it was being changed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: First and last stay at Fenwick Inn. Got there Thanksgiving day and was booked into a room that smelled of old cigarette smoke that was so overpowering that it sickened my wife. The guy at the front desk was really and truthfully helpful in making a considerable effort to find us a better room, and even let us check out 3 rooms before picking one. The first possible replacement was nearly as bad as the first. The next had a clearly damaged TV that (surprise) did not work. Finally settled into the 4th room, managed to get thru the night, only to find that the shower had no hot water the next morning, though the sick did. Literally, the hot water did not even flow to it other than a trickle! Call to the front desk was met with a perfunctory "maintenance will look into it" response from the woman on the other end of the phone. Not long after that we checked out, Do not waste your time or money. This place was supposed to be undergoing renovation, but clearly none of that has happened yet and may never. Won't ever go there again to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Rates were good!”
Reviews.Author: dogzrule
Reviews.Content: Okay so it was off-season - even though - the rates were great and they allow doggies! The pet rooms are on the second floor - I hear that there will be a major renovation on floors 2 thru 5 - floors 6&7 have already been renovated - then I hear the pet floor will be moved to the 7th floor, which I personally like since the views will be great - the only drawback would be: you will be right under the bar and restaurant. Oh well, can't have it all! I ate at the restaurant and thought it was very delicious. I had the delmonico steak with truffle gravy - wow, that was tasty! I didn't go swimming in the indoor pool and I hear they have a jacuzzi! The hotel is in a great location, walk across to the beach, Phillips seafood restaurant nearby, lots of restaurants, close to rehoboth, and if you need a vet, Savannah vet is super. Charles at the front desk was very helpful and nice. I think once the hotel is renovated, it will be right up there! I just hope they put down wood flooring or ceramic in the pet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: hmb01
Reviews.Content: Clean room, courteous staff and good price. Building is alittle older, so not the most modern accomodations. Nice pool, didn't use it, but it was definitely being used be families adn they seemed to be having a good time. Free coffee in the morning in the lobby. Vending machines available and game room, Walk to the beach just a block away. First time we stayed there, would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Autumn S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several places when going to Ocean City, but we tried the Fenwick Inn 2 years ago. Everytime we have stayed here, we have LOVED it! The staff is always so friendly, and they go above and beyond to make our stay nice. Their suites are amazing, and very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Just Barebones Lodging that is all”
Reviews.Author: Outbackdad
Reviews.Content: Made the mistake of booking online when we arrived at the front counter a caller was being offered the same sized room for forty dollars less. When I mentioned this at checkout I was told that I should have called up instead of booking online. There was mold on the ceiling of the bathroom, water damage on the ceiling, and torn wallpaper. This hotel needs a facelift. Trapped by our online booking we stayed, but we should have left. Parents with children should avoid the bar and grill on the top floor after 8 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: karamyl
Reviews.Content: We booked on hotels.com and got a rate of $59 per night for the weekday. That was a great starter. When we arrived at the hotel to my great surprise it was infect a hotel and not a motel. It has a newly renovated pool and jacuzzi, a bar, resteraunt, kids arcade and overall nice facility.

Reviews.Title: “You won't even get what you pay for...and that's not much.”
Reviews.Author: YorkTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Ocean City, Maryland, so I didn't quite know what to expect from the hotels in this town; however, based on what we saw of the Fenwick Inn, we won't be back. My husband, one-year-old son, and I were in town for a family reunion, so we saw quite a few rooms on the fifth and sixth floors. The lobby and elevators look like they may have been updated within the past few years, and the bathrooms on the fifth floor were fairly nice with granite countertops and new fixtures, but the bedding, walls, ceilings, and hallways probably look the same way they did forty or fifty years ago when this place opened. Our room was a king room on the sixth floor. Pros? It was spacious, the air conditioning unit worked, there was hot water and decent water pressure, and there was a mini fridge and microwave in the room. The hotel was just a short, one block walk to the beach. Cons? The hallways were incredibly dark and dingy -- like a bad horror movie with flickering fluorescent lights, popcorn ceilings, exposed water sprinkler pipes, and matted, old carpet. The rooms themselves were quite dated with broken furniture, ripped wallpaper, stains on the walls, water damage on the ceiling, and faded, dingy bedding. My first impression upon entering the room was..."Yuck." It wasn't exactly cheap, either, considering that it was off-season and that the hotel wasn't the best: $153 per night. It was not worth that much. Other things of note: To their credit, the front desk was fast with check-in and check-out. We ate at the hotel restaurant on the 8th floor, and it was mediocre. The food was good but not memorable, and it was definitely overpriced. The bar staff was friendly, and the drinks were cold -- no complaints there. They have an indoor pool, but we did not use it. Overall, the Fenwick Inn was ok, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Judy K
Reviews.Content: We took a mini vaca to OC MD late Aug. , unfortunately we had to push our trip back by a day due to Hurricane Irene. The front desk was extremely helpful and did not give us a hassel about the change. We stayed on the 5th floor, it appeared to be newly renovated. The bathroom was clean and modern, the room was a spacious king with a pull out sofa bed, the bed on the sofa was a bit cheap, but for a child its ok. We had breakfast on the Top floor restaraunt, which we heard good and bad reviews but , we found breakfast to be fine ,they had $3 breakfast specials which more than filed you up and provided a nice ocean view while you ate. The staff was very courteous and helpful throughout the hotel. they had a nice indoor pool and hot tub available as well. I foummd this place via an internet special and will definately be staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Sleeps - Nothing exciting”
Reviews.Author: GoodLifeJP
Reviews.Content: When we got snowed in up North in December, we stayed at this hotel. Hotel was clean, and reasonable, and one of the few open this time of year in this resort town. Seemed over populated with construction workers being housed who we found drinking in the elevators as we traveled from the beach back to our room. If nothing else available, it was clean and provided a roof over our heads, but comfort was somewhat lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room on the 5th floor and all will be well”
Reviews.Author: JN40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the process of being refurbished. Get a room on the 5th or 6th floor and you'll be happy. It's not the Ritz Carlton but it's clean, it's a great location for the beach (great fun pitch and putt ext door). Room was big. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom clean, worked well, lots of towells. The kids enjoyed the indoor pool. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: jcraig10
Reviews.Content: I usually try and stay in a hotel in the Choice Hotel chain so that I can earn points for future free stays. However, finding a room for 1 night at the end of July under $300 was almost impossible. Luckily, I was able to find the Fenwick Inn for $189 + tax. Wow, what a deal...even the front desk staff was surprised the rate was so low. ( I booked through the Ocean City website). At check in, the woman at the front desk was very friendly (forget her name now though). She said that she had a room available but it was on the 7th floor, just below the restaurant and asked us if that would be alright. (I suppose this would be bothersome to families with children). No problem for us though, as we just needed a place to sleep & shower. As I said, we were only in the room to sleep, but it was a nice, clean room. Some of these reviews are very negative when they really shouldn't be! Our bed was clean, our sheets/pillowcases/floor/bathroom/sink/tub everything was clean. I also liked that they had enough parking for everyone. There is parking in both the front and the back. We went up to the restaurant for some late night drinks. There were only a few other people in there, but it was fine and the drinks were reasonably priced. I have eaten dinner there previously, but they have since changed the name/owner? It was delicious when we ate there the first time, and I'm sure it still is. It is only a block+ from the beach, and you do have to cross Coastal Highway to get to it. There is an indoor pool, but I didn't get a chance to look at it, so can't help there. Oh yeah, and the beds were pretty comfortable...I slept great!

Reviews.Title: “wont go back”
Reviews.Author: may634
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the fourth floor and when the guest on the fifth floor flushed their toilet we heard the water going down the pipe through the walls. We could hear the kids in the next room talking. The carpet in the room we stayed in need to be replaced, the couch was torn. I stayed in less expensive hotels and the room was better than this one, It was not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Mold Mold Mold!”
Reviews.Author: anniewilm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in June 2010. The room was big and the front desk staff were helpful. The room and the entire hotel, however, wreaked of mold, To confirm our suspicions, we noticed some of the wallpaper was peeling back from the wall - guess what we saw? Lots of black mold. Blech! I wouldn't stay here again unless they gutted the whole thing down to its studs and rebuilt it.

Reviews.Title: “Update on my previous review. Skip this one now!”
Reviews.Author: Aquanut46
Reviews.Content: I had written a while back, I thouht the Fenwick was a good bargain. It has since been sold. Both my S/O and I feel it has gone progressively downhill. Actually, it is boardline seedy. The rooms were not kept very clean; bathroom floor was very dirty with hair in the corners; mold growing along the caulking. Both of us woke up the the first morning with bug bites all over our body. We checked for bed bugs, but did not see any sign of them fortunately! The rooms no longer have hair dryers which isn't a big deal, but it was nice. Internet connection is still iffy but they did have it fixed (again), after the first day. Upstairs bar no longer has the fun happy hours on Friday night with roast beef sandwiches and it's dead as a doornail now. It is definitely in need of a major overhaul and the sooner the better. After many years of staying here, we'll definitely be seeking alternative hotels for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “not great, yet not awful”
Reviews.Author: travelgurl79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in July. It was fine for a short visit, but I would not stay here for any longer than that. This hotel will not allow you to check in any earlier than 4PM, even though they clearly have rooms available. Housekeeping also begins service around 8:30AM, which stinks when you're trying to sleep in. The walls were very thin and there is very low water pressure in the shower. The room itself was clean, bed was comfortable, and we had plenty of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Packa123
Reviews.Content: There is no excuse for how run down this hotel is. In our room, part of the wallpaper was coming off, the bathroom door was splintered and the top layer of wood was off at parts, there were cigarette holes in the blanket, stains on the rug, the bathroom vent was caked with dirt, and the TV cords were taped to the back of the unit and barely staying in because there was a gaping hole. Overall, there is no excuse for a hotel with the amount of business they do not to stay up to date or take care of obvious problems. I specifically asked the hotel staff before I made my reservations if this hotels was up to date and read to her some of the negative comments that were left on the Internet. She assured me the comments were not accurate and the rooms looked just like the pictures on the Internet. The rooms looked nothing like the pictures. You get what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: relax-a-fun
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was a last minute decision to go to Ocean City and it was the only one available. Now, I usually stick to my traveling rule #1 and that is if the description says it’s a landmark and it doesn’t include any recent hotel renovations, expect old. Since I was anxious to go I decided to take a chance. The one photo of a room look passable but there’s definitely a reason why you can’t find too many of this hotel. The lobby [or what they call a lobby] has a run-down sofa and chairs set up that looks like an old doctor’s office. The room smelt like old wet carpet, the back of the bathroom door was peeling, no iron or ironing board, and it was just very raunchy. Don’t need to say too much more than this building needs to be torn down and built back up. This owner is making way too much money for this building to look like this. We paid $300 per night for something that looks like an old trucker's quick stop. If it’s the landmark of Ocean City, keep it top notch so that it shows as a classic to visitors and not as the overly priced freak hotel. I enjoyed Ocean City but not this stay. However, the girls at the front desk displayed good customer service. I didn't even go to the 8th floor to check on the Skyline Bar I was so irritated. It may be the best thing going for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, it was awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnnylynch
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Fenwick Inn. The staff and the room was killer. We will for sure be back again!

Reviews.Title: “never stay at this hotel, ever.”
Reviews.Author: domracer
Reviews.Content: I arrived in ocean city on july 3rd for a short visit to the beach. I inquired at the fenwick inn on room availaiblity and was told that they were cleaning two rooms, which was a surprise at 9pm, but who was I to question it. I filled out a check in card at their request and was told that my room would be ready in 20 minutes and that they would call me on my cell phone. So I proceeded up to their 8th floor bar to have a drink while the room was being prepped. after about 30 minutes i decided to go down to the front desk to inquire about my room. Once the employee saw me that promised me the room, he disappeared into the back and sent out a woman who then told me that they had sold the room and they tried to call me on my cell phone. My phone had full signal and it never was called by them. When I asked to speak to the young gentleman, I was told that he left for his other job, even though I saw him on premises. Very unprofessional behavior from this resort hotel, which I could see was being run like a sh@# house. Maybe it was better that I did not stay there. It's just the fact that I was lied to and should not have been promised a room. Once again, buyer beware, hotels like this one should not be patronized at all!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I will not return to this hotel unless major renovation”
Reviews.Author: farmgirl1629
Reviews.Content: Check mattresses and boxsprings on these old beds for cleanliness. Broken dresser with drawer front coming off. Sticky bathroom floor. Pictures I took of bed's boxsprings are too disgusting to post. Lobby furniture is dirty and tattered. No security.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley horrible”
Reviews.Author: mikenas007
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my family and let me tell you it was by far the worse hotel ive ever stayed at in my life the hotel is very out dated the beds are twin size and extremly cheap our bodys were so sore the next day we actually just ended our trip and went home there is only like 7 channels they charged us 300 for the night its very dirty they need to shut this place down please read the reviews guys do not waste your money seriously omg the pillows are like paper I would use this place as a source of military training for torture

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with crappy service”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyLibrarian
Reviews.Content: So, the room was ok. The walls were thin as I could hear hallway traffic and neigboring rooms. The stay was ok. Make sure you double check your bags before you leave. If you forget something you will be spending the next 5 days constantly calling to try and get ahold of someone. I was trasnferred many times to other lines and eventually hung up on. I left messages and nobody ever returned them. I was even once told, "You're going to have to call back later because you called me at a busy time." The funny thing is that I called at all different times of the day. The end result- no luck. Nothing had been logged and the item is gone forever. I hope whoever has my library book is kind enough to return it to the library.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodations”
Reviews.Author: weezulguy
Reviews.Content: We attended a friend's suprise 50th birthday party at Jordan's Rooftop Lounge on the 8th floor here, and spent the evening as well. The facilities are nice, the food was good, staff was friendly. The room was comfortable enough, although the toilet wouldn't flush properly. I would suggest picking a room on the back side of the hotel and near the floor to avoid Route 1 traffic noise and lounge noise from the restaurant. Being that we were on a motorcycle, I was please to be able to use covered parking.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at The Fennwick Inn....Awful!”
Reviews.Author: S7eeler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely dirty. The staff were rude, unprofessional and they don't know what it means to treat customers nice. The entire hotel was extremely dirty and disgusting. It smelled horrible, there weren't enough towels. When we called down for more towells we were told she wa sthe only person there, so she;ll tell the person in housekeeping. we never got any more towels. The room was so dirty that it made me feel terrible. they should close it down - quite honestly. Anyone staying here that likes it really can't have too high expectations. It was filthy. The swimming pool was so dirty...like the water hadn't been treated in a long time. It was gross! We would never stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place 2 stay”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey1583
Reviews.Content: I have been 2 ocean city numerous times since my husband and I got married almost 10 yrs ago. This yr we went 2 ocean city 4 a family reunion in the begining of may. the rooms were amazing and our kids and all the other kids loved the pool area. we stayed a week and my family loved it. my husband and i r going back in the middle of june just 2 get away 4 a wk. We have always stayed at the fenwick and will continue 2 stay there. we were always aloud 2 check in early except for 1 time. We luv ocean city and we luv 2 stay at the fenwick

Reviews.Title: “Terrible from check in to check out”
Reviews.Author: Dennis082
Reviews.Content: I am 67 years old and a military retiree so upon check in, I asked the clerk if they offered a senior citizen or military discount. her somewhat nasty reply was "No, we only have a limited number of rooms that we offer discounts on and they are all sold out" Although we requested a non smoking room, as soon as you stepped off the elevator on the floor where our room was there was a very strong smell of cigarette smoke. The only easily accessable electrtical outlets were in the bathroom and they did not work. The only way we could use our cell phone recharger and hair dryer was to pull the dresser out from the wall, unplug a lamp and plug into that outlet. There were none of the ammenaties offered by other motels of the same price range (no iron/ironing board; no hair dryer, no exhause vent in the bathroom; no in room coffee maker' no continental breakfast) when housekeeping came to clean the room the housekeeper said she only had 1 towel and would bring more later. that didn't happen until I called the front desk and when we returned to our room later the towels were laying on the floor in front of our room. The A/C unit had food particles in the vent. The doors stuck and were difficult to open. Because the doors stuck, when you shut the door you had to slam it which made a loud noise and i am sure was disturbing to other guests. After checking out, my wife told me she had forgot a folder with important papers in it that she left in the dresser drawer under the TV. I called back to the hotel and asked the clerk to check it out. Her reply was that she could not get hold of housekeeping and they would be the ones who would need to check it out. I asked if security could check it out and she said she could not get in touch with security and she said she would pass it on to the manager and someone woud call me back. After more than an hour, no one had called back so I called again and spoke with a different person. When i explained to her what was happening, she had a "careless attitude" and stated she did not take the original call. I then asked to speak to the manager. In speaking with the manager said she would have to wait until housekeeping checked in with her and as soon as they contacted her, she would pass it on to them. More than an hour later someone else called and stated they did not find the items we were looking for. Thru the whole ordeal of check in, the stay and check out and after, no one seemed to care or ensure our stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “terrible manager”
Reviews.Author: jadael69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here specifically because of the indoor pool!! We were in town with a cheer competition and the girls didn't get done until later in the evening. Since it is still chilly the indoor pool was a great way for them to unwind at night. Charles (the manager) was one of the nastiest people I have ever met in the customer service industry. The girls would get back and want to swim and Charles would annouce over the speaker "GET OUT OF THE POOL it is adult swim".....when the kids were taking too long for him he came back over the loud speaker and said "I AM GOING TO GIVE YOU TILL THE COUNT OF 3".....RUDE! I left a message for the supervisor, but he never called me back. Our entire team stayed at this hotel, as well as many others! NOT NEXT YEAR!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...Great Service...keep in mind for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: WeezieLove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our dog for 4 nights. All the staff was very acomodating. The hotel in general was clean and comfortable. The pool area was nice. The room was clean, however, there were some maintanance issues that could be addressed, i.e. torn wall paper, torn/stained curtains. At the same time we did stay on second floor, which is designated as the pet floor and we didn't have high expectations. Overall we had a great time and were very pleased at accomodations for the money. Becky, at the Front Desk, was extremely helpful from reservation to check-in and throughout our stay. We would highly recomend this hotel to folks that have value in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Service can be a deciding factor on returning to a hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfergoof
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Fenwick previously and have enjoyed our stay most times. The only thing that I would like to see implemented is a period of time when the pool is designated for adults only and that that could be enforced. On this particular trip, I would like to compliment your front desk staff of Becky and Donna. However, the most pleasant staff member of all was Summer Burdette. She was always smiling and when she spoke to me, she remembered my name as well as my wife. During our stay, a lot of workers who were working @ the Delaware Power Plant were also staying there. Being an early riser, I was down in the lobby around 5:15 every morning and was surprised to find the coffee already brewed. Summer told me that most of the workers staying at the hotel are usually on the road prior to 6AM so she makes a pot of coffee so they can have some on their way to work. It doesn't seem like much, but little things like that have an influence on peoples opinions of hotels or resorts. I would like Summer to know that we enjoyed our stay and she was a major part of it. Thanks again and you'll see us many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service, bad trip overall”
Reviews.Author: sapphire1306
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel last summer. It was one of the cheapest we could find so we took it. Check in time was 4 pm we got there a little early hoping to get in. Unfortunately we weren't so we waited, and waited, and waited.. we never got into our room until 6 pm!!! While we waited, the service desk people were not very nice and had nothing to compensate for us waiting over 2 hours after check in for our room. We then we hoping to get a shower so we could finally start our vacation, only to find out our shower was not working so we had to call maintainence and have them come up and fix our shower. Over our stay we also heard people talking about weeks before a child that drown in the pool because they have no lifeguards or anyone working there to look over the pool activity. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!! WARNING: DONT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible- Dirty- Rude Staff- Hidden fee's”
Reviews.Author: hesteje
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER stay here again. The place stinks of animals and smoke. The staff are very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Fenwick Inn lets the police harass law abiding citzens.”
Reviews.Author: mobileconsultants
Reviews.Content: There was on or about Feb. 25th someone who said they could smell marajuana. No one even knows if this is true. What do they do at the fenwick?? The let the police go door to door and searching rooms and ripping guests rooms apart. Literally, took the guests luggage and empty all the contents out and trash the rest of their room. They went through ALL THE ROOMS LIKE THEY WERE THE GESTAPO. Two men who had just gotten there were throughly searched through all their belongings. Note: they went door to door forcing their way into PAID guests rooms for someone smoking pot?? They went to EVERY room on that floor. Is this what Fenwick Inn does to all thier guests?? An entire floor has to be searched probably at least 25 rooms because someone thought they smelled pot? I am anxious to frind out how they the police and fenwick inn respond.

Reviews.Title: “GOING DOWNHILL”
Reviews.Author: bellagirl1
Reviews.Content: Thia place was terrible. When we went to take showers the next morning we only had two sets of towels for five people.When I went to ask housekeeping for more she said she didnt have any. I had to go to three others before I could get any and she was only able to give me two. That is pretty sad that they dont have enough towels for everbody. The place was dirty and smelly. Kids were running around @3am and hit our door and woke us. Why do you have cameras on the floors if you dont use them?? The place has REALLY went downhill since the last time I was there. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The trip, hotel and stay was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: wvccgolfer
Reviews.Content: For several years i have been running a golf trip three times a year from northeastern Pa. to OC, Md. We have stayed exclusively for the past 12-15 years at the Fenwick Inn Without exception our trips have met or exceeded our expectations. The pricing, service, amenities, and courtesies make this an ideal location for golf outings, family trips or business meetings. The management team of Greg and Beth are professional, attentive and extremely accommodating eager to serve and address your needs and concerns. The front desk staff of Becky, Donna and other capable and caring individuals greet you with both friendly and caring service. The rooms and pool area have been remodeled and upgraded and the top floor bar and restaurant are undergoing a transformation to better serve you the guest. This first class facility ideally located in north OC within walking distance to the beach stands eager and ready to make your stay enjoyable, pleasant, and satisfying hoping that you will make the Fenwick Inn an annual destination.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChaseWaves
Reviews.Content: Ocean City is about tradition. Boardwalk fries, crab cakes, mini-golf, the beach, and the Fenwick Inn! My family loves this place. I have been here at least 100 times. It has been awesome every time. The staff is super friendly, They are very helpful when it comes to anything. They really do care that you have a great stay. Jordon's Rooftop has a great view and delicious food. It is open to the public so if you have your own place down here, you should still check it out! The bar is fully stocked with all the best drinks. There is a pool table and other games as well. Check it out on a weekend night. You can find some great music and dancing.The pool is super comfortable. It has a huge hot tub with jets. The heated pool even has jets! It also has an outdoor seating area to relax in the sun. The rooms are perfect. The beds and pillows are super comfortable. Huge TVs in each room, fridge, and a nice view on either side of the building. IF YOU DONT READ ANY OF THE ABOVE AT LEAST READ THIS...........you will not find a better hotel in Ocean City for the prices the Fenwick Inn is offering. Do yourself a favor, take a look at some of the rates other places charge just to stay there. WOW! How can you be expected to rent a jet ski or go out to eat! Craziness. The Fenwick Inn understands that people want to come and enjoy the beach, the food, the boardwalk, everything. They want people to have fun here and come back soon. That is why my family does. We love it here! Oh yeah to to top it all off, they are dog friendly during the off season! (I wish it was all season) You can bring the pooches to enjoy the beach and boardwalk during your stay. Trust me, stay here. You will come back time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill...”
Reviews.Author: mapology97
Reviews.Content: I always went to this hotel since I was very young. Back then the rooms seemed incredibly clean and the hotel itself seemed to be well maintained. However, from my recent vacation, i think it is sadly time to move on. The rooms were dirty and the bads were a little bit uncomfortable. The hallways were also musty and didn't give anything attractive about this hotel. The room was rather bare and outdated. However, i am glad that t does have a refrigerator. I also have come to enjoy the pool are after its renovation. The rooftop restaurant is very convenient and has a very indulging taste. However, after seeing this for about three years now, i think it is time for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fenwick Inn Friday, December 17 through Sunday, December 19. We really enjoyed our stay. The Fenwick Inn is conveniently located right next to DE, so we did most of our shopping and dining there since there is no sales tax in DE. We love Ocean City in the offseason since it is so quiet. We were just looking for a weekend to getaway. The Front Desk was very friendly and courteous upon check-in. We were able to check in a few hours before the official check-in time of 4pm which was wonderful so we could go shopping before dinner. We opted for a suite since it was offseason and the price difference wasn't that much. We were so glad we did. We had a dining area with a microwave and frig. Those really came in handy since my husband could not finish his dinner one evening so he was able to put it in the frig and then reheat it for lunch the next day. The suite also had 2 bathrooms. The master bathroom had a jacuzzi tub in it which was great so my husband and I could have some privacy. The bed was very comfortable and the bedding looked and felt brand new. The suite also had a living room that was separate from the bedroom. Both rooms had a flat screen TV with HD channels which my husband loved. My husband and I hope to plan another stay at the Fenwick Inn in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “the room, the view, the bar and the breakfast make this my perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdbigwavedave
Reviews.Content: The beds are very comfortable with 5 soft pillows. Try to get an east facing room and enjoy an awesome sunrise if weather permits. All the meals are good but, their breakfast is absolutely one of the best in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - will come back”
Reviews.Author: DHS636
Reviews.Content: Nice clean large room - comfortable bed with ample blankets and pillows. The rooftop bar was great and the Happy Hours specials were wonderful I especially liked that I was able to take my bike (21 speed) into my room. The rear entrance service elevator made it a snap.The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. The night clerk came to my room and set up my wi-fi. Good location away from the madding crowd and noise of the lower numbered streets. The price was right! I will be back next year! Dave S. Annapolis, Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sco2000
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a week at the Fenwick this summer and had a ball, we have 4 kids under 10. It was clean, great service, and very affordable. A little out of the way of the boardwalk but everything else was well worth it. Great stay and I would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: NicholeW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the car show frm thur to sunday with 4 ppl; i was nervous to stay here b/c of the reviews i read befor hand; but the sevice was quick to check in; & the housekeeping was good just a little slow at times. The roof top resturant had an awsome view & prob the best food we had the whole trip! And it was only a 1 min walk to the beach but was very far from the nightlife & boardwalk. Otherwise i would deff stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fenwick Inn - Very hospitable and Good value”
Reviews.Author: enielcarey
Reviews.Content: We have held our family reunion at the Fenwick Inn for the second consecutive year. Beth Perunko, Fenwick Manager, was very helpful in making suggestions and arrangements for a very successful event. We found the facility well managed and maintained, the rooms were spacious and recently re-decorated. A problem with a sink drain was fixed promptly. The micro wave and refrigerator worked very well. While the room did not have a coffee maker, fresh coffee was available continuously just off the lobby. The participants in our reunion were very positive about the Fenwick Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: gatorman73
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine,and the stay was nice! I would make a suggestion! We had a small cat with us and did NOT use the maid service,as we just needed towels etc.I think that when you save the Inn money and time,they could do the same for you by waiving the pet fee of $10 a day!!!They don't even charge 18 yr. olds to stay and they are ADULTS NOT CHILDREN!! They need to reconsider this policy,when you don't use their service,thus saving them MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: “The room was beautiful, clean, and very spacious!”
Reviews.Author: fwhitt123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay a the Fenwick at least twice a year. Our experiences there are always wonderful. The front desk is very helpful and accomodating, the kids love their pool, and the rooms are very nice, always very clean, and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: pacolsu
Reviews.Content: Had a conference and needed a place to stay and the Fenwick was a good choice. Front desk very freindly and their was complimentaqry coffee in the AM. King Bed was comfortable with a nice large window

Reviews.Title: “don't ever”
Reviews.Author: taradise73
Reviews.Content: i stayed there with my 3 kids. it was the worse vacation ever. the rooms need to be updated. no iron or iron boards, the ceiling just falls at will. only positive thing to say is staff was nice and the room is a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility and Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: eaglesview_10
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Fenwick Inn and had a great experience. I do a lot of travel and generally speaking have low expectations. When you visit a busy town/city - expectations are even lower. I was pleasantly surpised and impressed with the staff as well as the actual facility. The staff actually looked at you in the eyes and spoke directly to you, the room was very clean, and the staff even asked if I needed help with travel plans etc. Overall a geat experience in a "beach town" full of "no tell motels". Fenwick gets a tall Thumbs up and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Affordable Oceanview room!”
Reviews.Author: bzm38
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fenwick Inn and had a great experience. The room was clean and updated with granite counters and a flat screen tv. We had an ocen view, one block away. Check in staff and room cleaning staff were very nice. You can't beat the location and amenities for the price you pay. In the past, we have traveled often and this room ranks high. Now we have four young children and even the one block walk to the beach was easy. Plus they have an indoor pool that my kids enjoyed in the evenings. I would highly recommend this hotel. The price and location are great for a family. We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Unless you like filth and cockroaches and being ripped off, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Beps711
Reviews.Content: We go to Ocean City, MD every year at the same time. This year we decided to try the Fenwick Inn. The room "seemed" ok at first. As the days went by we found little things here and there. The curtains being stained with who knows what. And it wasn't a little stain either. There was dried up chinese food on one of the chairs. The last straw came the day before we were scheduled to leave. We came back from breakfast to find cockroaches on the outside of our door. To me, cockroaches = filth. We got our stuff together and left immediately. The thought of staying another night made me sick. When we checked out we still got charged the extra night stay regardless that we left early due to the lack of cleanliness and have cockroaches, probably crawl on us at night. And the free WiFi...forget it. There is no such thing at this hotel. We learned a very valuable lesson. You get what you pay for. Back to Best Western next year. Horrible experience but Ocean City did not disappoint as usual.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE-STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Exploit
Reviews.Content: 35 years of travelling and this concrete bunker is the worst I've encountered. Don't believe the website pictures. Check-in is not convenient and staff seems easily overwhelmed. Stayed on second floor. Hallway carpets and wallpaper were worn and stained. Room was disgusting - carpet appears to have been there for 20+ years, wallpaper was torn and stained, overhead paint flaking, drapes have multiple holes in them, water stains on walls in bathroom and bedroom, furniture is outdated and was chipped, room has a musty odor, electrical sockets are overloaded, inside bathroom door has chipping peeling paint, sink and counter are stained. Bed was clearly old and uncomfortable, and bedding was questionable regarding cleanliness. The pool area kept closing and reopening, and was often overrun by unsupervised children.
