Not a very inviting "Aquatic Area". Restaurant is very basic with plastic tablecloths and no food items to brag about. They should advertise and charge for what this is: a decrepit establishment to stay when nothing else is avaliable and not charge over 39 dollars a night. If folks actually tolerate this establishment as some have indicated, then clearly they are not used to much better than a YMCA. Pure and simple - this is a flop house when nothing else can be found, and no one seems to care about good taste, comfort or hygiene. I made a mistake booking at last minute through Expedia. I've notified Expedia of the disgusting stay and will let others know. Don't make my mistake - find quality accomodations elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Staff friendly and accomodating, but”
Reviews.Author: sbjstd91
Reviews.Content: rooms leave much to be desired. Most of our family was on 7th floor - rooms had recently been redone and were much nicer than ours on the 2nd floor (ugh). On a plus - sheets were of quality I have at home. All in all, hotel tired. New linens and bathroom vanities on upper floors added a lot, but wallpaper still peeling, ceilings dirty. Definitely NOT worth the almost $400 we spent for 2 nights. Jordan's restaurant was a pleasant surprise and we ate two breakfasts, one lunch and our dinner on arrival there. Expensive as you would expect for a "resort area", but food (especially crab cakes) outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lamartinwv
Reviews.Content: We had another reservation @ HoJo but got bumped two days before departure due to overbooking. So we scrambled to find another hotel and landed on this one. I read all the reviews so I was a bit skeptical to say the least but choices are slim when there's a time crunch. Upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel, our room, location, etc. I have no complaints about cleanliness or hotel staff. Our room was clean, no odors, cleaned daily. The rooftop restaurant has great food and nice bar area. The pool and hottub were also nice. Overall, a great experience! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Instead of Fenwick Inn, should be called "Filthy Inn"”
Reviews.Author: lami92
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a two night stay at the Fenwick and was throughly discusted with the cleanliness of this hotel when we opened room 236's door the smell of musty, possible urine smell was overpowering, there was a sofabed that should have been in the landfill not the room it was tore on the arms of the sofa and was dirty like someone ate chicken wings, read a newspaper and wiped grease all over the cushions and arms of the couch. Stains were all over the carpet when you first walked in the room, dust bunnies all over the lamps shades and in the corners of the room and in the bathroom, toilet did not want to flush no pressure. Could hear everything going on out in the hallway and in the next adjoining room. The ceiling of the room had a huge crack going across that obviously must have had a leak up above because water stains were on the ceiling and where the water came in the wallpaper was peeling away from the walls. There were stains on the curtains. When the maid was vaccuming the room up above us it sounded as if she was vaccuming our room. The bathroom walls looked like they hadn't been wiped down in years. The sofabed was the most uncomfortable bed I ever tried to sleep on. The fan in the bathroom may as well have been turned off because it did nothing. I notified the frontdesk and was told that the manager was not there, that she left a note for him to call me about the matter but as of 8:54pm on 7/30/10 no phone call yet!

Reviews.Title: “Good price but will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: review3Pa
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a week's vacation stay at this hotel. The girls who cleaned our room were very good. Everything else needs to be better. They have a pool that's the size for a family to swim in. Not for an entire hotel! My two girls (age 5 and 4) tried it out once. We lasted 15 min. My 5 year old got her hand swollowed up by a pvc pipe that is in the pool. There isn't a protected wrap around it or anything!! Are you kidding me! I'm a strong guy and it took me quite a bit of force to pull her hand back out. Needless to say, we never went back in that pool! I was so pissed off! Also, everyone in that pool were disrespectful. Adults were splashing around and bumping into my kids. Really?? Were do these people grow up?! Not one of the life guards said anything to anyone about horsing around and jumping into the pool. There were water puddles throughout the hotel lobby and in the elevator. The hotel was in a nice location though. Far enough from the college/high school crowd, but close enough to drive to. Good mini-putt right across the street and a good hoagie shop.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, For the Price”
Reviews.Author: vlm2138
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fenwick Inn. Not bad for the price. The beach is across the street, which my kids preferred to stay on this end instead of going to the busy boardwalk end of the beach. The hotel is a little run down, could use some updating. The pictures on the website are nothing like the rooms in the hotel, they were staged, did not have the flat screen TV nor the plush chairs.They offer a 5 people stay but the beds are a full size so you must get a cot at 10 extra dollars a night or sleep on the flithy carpet, which could really use a darn good shampoo or replaced. Never ate in the restaurant, because the food did not look appetizing. The housekeeping crew were very polite and they seemed to work really hard but overall it was a place to stay, not expensive and the staff was friendly. Never had a problem checking in/out but did have to change our room key 6 times because it would deactivate. You do have to pay for internet service if you want to use your laptop, no free internet service. Don't think I would stay again, mainly beause it is too far from where we wanted to be.

Reviews.Title: “Some inconveniences but overall pleased”
Reviews.Author: jkoneski1
Reviews.Content: I agree with the two reviews below mine about the check in procedures. We arrived early and were told we could not check in until 4:00 but were welcomed to use the restaurant/bar upstairs or use their facilities to change and go to the beach. We arrived back at the hotel at 3:45 to check in and the line was out the door. My boyfriend and I decided to leave and come back, as we would probably be in line for at least an hour. We came back at around 6:00 and there was still a very long line. We checked in on a Sunday and were told that lines like that are common on that day of the week, so beware. After check in we were given a room on the 6th floor. Overall we were very happy with it. The beds were so comfortable and the room was quiet (luckily we scored a corner room and didn't have a neighbor on the other side). Not once did we experience rudeness or hostility from the staff. Housekeeping did knock pretty early (i'd say around 8:30 am) but we were up around then anyways. When we arrived the pool was closed and were told it would reopen indefinitely. We were upset about this because our stay was for 2 days, our full day promising rain. The hotel gave us free passes to the Jolly Roger Water Park and it was probably the most fun we had all weekend. I can't say I wasn't still disappointed about the closed pool but the passes were a great value. They supposedly have free internet but it did not work in our corner room. We used it in the lobby no problem. We had breakfast one morning at the hotel restaurant and found it to be satisfactory. It was inexpensive and the food was decent. The cost of this hotel was significantly less than anything else around. It was a block from the beach and a short drive to anywhere we wanted to go. We found the staff to be polite, the rooms to be clean and very comfortable. If i ever find myself in this area again i will stay at Fenwick Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: RoxyGirl68
Reviews.Content: Where do I even start? While staying here the last week of June it seemed like one thing after another that went wrong. Check in is later than any hotel/motel I've ever stayed at. The extremely rude front desk people wouldn't let anyone check in until 4pm. (we arrived at 3:15pm) So we decided to go lay by the indoor pool. Come to find out it's closed because someone died in it days prior. They promised it would be opened the following day. (we wouldn't of swam in it anyways..) It stayed closed the entire week. But they did give us comp passes to the Jolly Rogers water park. So we decided to wait in the rooftop bar/restaurant until 4. Guess everyone else had the same idea because the place was packed with people waiting to check in. I think this was their tactic to get people to buy food & drinks. The restaurant seemed extremely dirty and the food others were eating didn't look very good. At 4pm, we went to check in and found the lobby was packed and the line was out the door. We decided to get something to eat and come back later. Came back at 7:30pm and the line was still out the door. We waited for 45 minutes! This hotel really needs to change it's set up and registration process. Our room was big and spacious, had a good view, comes with a mini fridge/microwave. Don't expected any "extras" in the bathroom though. They gave us a tiny bar of soap & 1 mini shampoo. (we bring our own, so it wasn't a big deal) The walls were very thin, you could hear everything happening around you. There was trash in the hallways that laid there for days before anyone cleaned it up. The housekeeping people were very rude. They were banging on our door at 8:30am to clean our room! Our key cards kept getting demagnetized. I asked housekeeping if they could let us back in the room and she seemed so irritated that I was asking. Finally she told us just to go down to the front desk. I've stayed in some dumpy hotels before.. but this was bad. For $100 a night, we could of found somewhere nicer, friendlier and much better. I would never stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Issues with check-in and procedures”
Reviews.Author: beevain
Reviews.Content: Just back from a family reunion which was booked at the Fenwick Inn. We had people traveling from all over the east coast and as far away as Oregon. The hotel does not allow any early check-ins, nor will they atleast register guests prior to 4pm. Despite being on the road for 11 hours, we arrived at 3pm and couldn't even use accommodations prior to 4pm. (I have worked at hotels in Myrtle Beach, also a beach resort town. Should a room be ready prior to check-in we always proceeded with checking-in the guest. If not ready, we atleast registered the guest to avoid waiting in the long check-in lines later on. There were also facilities to change for pool/beach use.) I did not feel very welcomed by the staff there. In addition, the pool was closed and no alternatives were given. We were told they were cleaning the pool and it should be open later when in reality someone died the day before and the pool would be closed indefinitely. We found out later that water park passes were being given to guests, but no announcement was made. By the time we found out, we were checking out Sunday morning. (I do not mean to sound indifferent to someone's death. And I realize the beach is right there. We did have many elderly people who cannot sit in the sun and stay on the beach.) Besides bringing a large group there, we brough the hotel a lot of money between room rates, facility/banquet room, food and restaurant, I believe we were not treated as a top notch hotel should treat a guest. Our room was great and the food was great. But treatment was definitely below standards. Another inconvenience, the hotel did not include banquet and food for the reunion into the room rate, as many do for groups. We had to pay members of the group for our meal and someone else for the banquet room rental. Needless to say, I was exteremely disappointed with how the front desk staff treated the guests. At check-out, a woman with a disabled mother decided to stay another night. Would you believe that they made her check out and remove her luggage at 11am and wait to re-check in at 4pm. We advised her to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal - Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: CPFC3338
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of a friend my wife decided to stay here for our 25th annversiy. The package was perfect. The room was clean, quiet and the staff was friendly. The beach was right accross the street. The pool was also adequate and clean.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: yodab
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 grown children and I stayed here for the Air Show weekend. We had adjoining rooms which was nice. The rooms are definetly showing their age. Ours had water damage all along the ceiling. The carpet was worn and stained in places. The rooms were large enough and had microwaves and mini friges, but no coffee makers. However, coffee was available in the lobby in the morning from 6 a.m. to 11 a.m.. The pool and hot tub were not inviting partly due to children running wild and young adults taking over. We did not realize until we were in Ocean City that it was also graduation week. This property had its share of young, apparently underage drinkers which made us a little uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the Bucks!”
Reviews.Author: Aquanut46
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times and have always had a good experience. No, it is not a 5-star hotel but neither are the rates. It is comfortable and clean. The staff is always extremely accommodating. Their newly redone aquatic center is a bit of a joke but it is an indoor pool and hot tub (sometimes overun with kids) but don't see much difference than the old aquatic center. Although they do have wireless, it is somewhat iffy in the rooms and understand they are still working out the kinks. Beds are comfortable and nice to have a refrigerator in the room. Upstairs bar has a great happy hour; reasonable drinks and appetizers. Daily coffee in the lobby which is nice. Parking is easy and you can get some great rates by thinking ahead and using AAA or Govt ID or AARP.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel .... Good Price”
Reviews.Author: jack21903
Reviews.Content: The rates for a room in this hotel are great, it's located on the northern end of OC, but still in close proximity to alot of attractions. We've stayed at this hotel several times and never experienced any issues. The pool is OK, but very steamy and I always sit under one of the panels that drip :-( Rooms are clean, but older amenities and building. If you are looking for a place that is reasonably priced so you have money to do everything OC has to offer - look no further. Just don't have high expectations, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Price”
Reviews.Author: higgysbaby
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for two nights, the hotel is nice and the rooms were clean. The pool is a great feature also. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvlthewrld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at Fenwick Inn for the past 4 years and every time we are glad to have stayed at Fenwick Inn. We are both clean freaks and not up for staying at a place with stray hairs or stains on things. All the times we've stayed, our rooms have been clean and tidy. We always feel accomodated when we request a specific room location. The actual location of the hotel is far from the boardwalk (approx. 100 streets away) but when we want that type of action, we can always find a parking spot 1 or 2 blocks back from the boardwalk crowds. We have found the indoor pool and hot tub a very nice feature in case of rain. It's not your 4 star hotel that's extra fancy but when rates skyrocket in the summer months, this place accomodates. They typically have specials on their website and if you have AAA, you can make out great! We would recommend giving it at least 1 try.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THAT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: weazeldo
Reviews.Content: The wife and I went for a weekend away. When we got their, we found out there was a cheerleader competition in town. The kids ran around the hotel all hours and the parents we saw did not make an effor to control them. I called the front desk and they did nothing either. The hotel is old. The room doors do not close tightly (see hall ligh all the way around the frame). The walls were thin. The hotel is good if you have kids and the indoor pool is great if you can get a chance to use it without screaming kids. We found the rooftoplounge and dining the only enjoyable experiences. The wait staff at the brunch was fantastic. Its was a good place to eat and drink but the lodging had a lot to be desired

Reviews.Title: “Awsome experience”
Reviews.Author: abramsfamily2006
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in this hotel for 3 days to get away from a snow storm in Delaware. And if we ever go back in Ocean city for any reason, the only hotel we would ever stay at would be Fenwick Inn. We just needed a place to sleep at for couple nights, but ended up having a mini vacation. The whole environment is very warm and welcoming, the staff is super friendly, we really did feel like special favorite guests. They have very nice restaurant on the roof top of the hotel, indoor heated pool, spa. It felt really good to lay in that spa during the blizzard. Rooms were very clean and homey. Housekeepers were on top of everything. Overall had a great time and was very nice unplanned get away in the middle of the winter. Definitely RECOMMEND it to EVERYONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: gizmoBeltsville
Reviews.Content: If your looking to stay at the Grand Hyatt - then go to the Grand Hyatt. Our stay with our 2 small dogs at the Fenwick was a great bargin, clean room, and gracious front desk folks. This is a simple hotel, nothing fancy, but a good deal on the purse strings, & a great location for a fun weekend. The restaurant, Jordan's, is their rooftop diner and has a great view of OC with really good breakfasts. Pet friendly off season, you get the most bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Service. Will Be Back For Another Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1969
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay at the Fenwick was GREAT! The rooms were my self and several family memebers stayed were amazing. Completely re-done and very clean! The service was top notch! I have no complaints at all. Myself and my family will be staying there anytime we visit Ocean City. Also, the restaurant had great food. Andrew

Reviews.Title: “We stay there since they take dogs”
Reviews.Author: lilmissdaisie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the spring and again this fall and the rooms were fine. You get what you pay for, and for 3 nights in early October we paid $150 which (to be honest) was what some other hotels were charging for just 2 nights. They accept dogs on the 2nd floor and the rooms are beat up from other dogs, but we were happy to be able to bring him with us. They have a cool pool, which is great to use. The restaurant upstairs is just ok. We had drinks there one night but didn't have any specials. The only place we could find at had drink specials was Seacrets, and they have drink specials every night. Liquid Assets is a great wine bar that's closer to Fenwick. Philip's buffet is about 2 or 3 walking blocks north and was an ok place for dinner. The hotel is one block from the beach and is very nice to have the entire beach to yourself. Fenwick is a decent place for not so much $, that accepts pets.

Reviews.Title: “Agree, Best hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: shoffy66
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fenwick Inn, as we have done numerous times in the past, for our wedding anniversary. I don’t get why everyone complains this place. It is the best deal on the beach. We stayed two nights for $150 after taxes. They redid their pool and it was a savior this past weekend with the rain and winds. The room was clean and made up by the staff very professionally after every night. The bed was very comfortable. Sure, the couch was faded from age, but that was not a big deal at all. The staff was friendly and helpful in every way. I would recommend the Fenwick Inn to anyone who is looking for a quiet hotel and trying not to spend a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: OCTraveler3
Reviews.Content: Great rates, and the hotel is clean and the rooms are decent. The bed was comfortable, and the room was a good size. You could get a nicer room closer to the boardwalk, but you will also spend three times as much! Besides, it's just two bucks for a bus ticket that is good all day and it will take you anywhere. The front desk staff was very friendly. They directed us to good restaurants and places to visit. The housekeepers were nice, and did a very good job picking up our room. Check-in is kind of late, but we were warned of that when we made our reservation. Just don't leave your house so early in the morning and you are fine! The restaurant on the top was good, and very reasonably priced compared to most other places.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: bestmommom
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel through a traval agent and we stayed for 4 nights. the girl in the restaurant was very rude each and every morning we went up to eat breakfast. the bath towels in the room could have used a lot of bleach because they were a light brown color NOT WHITE. The pool and hot tub were dirty and the front door to the hotel looked like it was not cleaned all summer. I would not say at this hotel again if it were free!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for quiet hotel close to beach”
Reviews.Author: pugm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and got a special rate of about 89 per night which we were very happy with. Hotel has some age on it, but was clean and rooms were large. Had microwave and refrig and table and chairs in room. Decor was dated, but still nice. The view from our room was the parking lot, but we didnt spend much time in room anyway, so that did not bother us much. The beds were very comfortable. Kids loved the pool and hot tub. Nice view of beach and bay from the upper floors. We ate breakfast at the resteraunt and food was good. Best part of hotel is that it is such a short walk to beach and hotel is located close to Deleware so beach is very quiet and relaxing there. Great for families with kids and people who love the beach and want to stay in quiet area away from all the hubbub of the boardwalk. Great deal for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: fmheine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four weekday nights at the Fenwick Inn. We were looking for a reasonably priced, clean hotel close to the beach. Found a great deal through Expedia and we were very pleased with the results. You can spend a lot more money getting something newer, fancier or closer to the beach but we felt that we got a great value for our money. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly, all elevators were working, food in the restaurant was good, pleasant happy hour in the bar and a block away from a very nice beach. A few times we wished that the hotel was closer to the southern end of Ocean City where most of the attractions are but this was not a big hardship and we were not willing to pay a premium price just to avoid a little driving. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: Monique88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. I saw mold in the bathroom and the comforters were stained. I didn't make a complaint because I didn't think it was worth complaining. I checked around and the Fenwick was the only hotel that we could stay at for one night. We've stayed in other hotels in Ocean City, MD that weren't a whole lot better, but they didn't have mold, stains, and I think the staff was better. We were only there for one night to celebrate our 12th Anniversary. We took our 6 and 8 year old and they had a wonderful time. We made the best of it and we also had a great time at the beach, boardwalk, pool, and restaurants. Two weeks ago, we went on a vacation in Riviera Maya, Mexico and we stayed for a week for a great price. Best vacation ever! We paid less to stay in an all inclusive resort for one night in Mexico then to travel to Ocean City. It's just not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets in the O.C. (okay, that's an overstatement)”
Reviews.Author: eliihaysee
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel on a whim. I've been staying at condos and hotels in OC every summer, all of my life. I found this one with an ad in the Washington Post. The room rates were quite cheap for the week I stayed. I looked on tripadvisor and found that the reviews were split 50/50. Check-in is at 3, plenty of parking in the front and rear off of the Coastal Highway. The hotel is about 10 blocks south of the Fenwick, Deleware border. I was pleased with the room because on the 6,7,8th floors you can get a room with an ocean view (not ocean front). The room was decent (not great, looked well used and as old as the hotel itself). And of course, there's no water pressure but atleast there was hot water. The best part of the room was the very comfy bed. The worst part was the tv with no remote. Rooms come with a microwave, and mini-fridge. Fenwich offers a free wi-fi network, but most rooms are separated by a concrete wall. You can always go sit in the lobby or rec room to get a good signal. There are so many choices for restaurants in Ocean City, and you just have enough choices within 4 blocks from the hotel. Room service is efficient and thorough. There's an indoor pool that seems to be quite popular on rainy days with the younger crowd. On the 8th floor, Jordan's Restaurant serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I ate breakfast at Jordans every day, it was rather cheap and easy. However, while the bar boasts that it has cheaper drinks, the dinner menu is a bit pricy. I would recommend this hotel to almost anyone that will travel to OC. Whether you're new to the city, or you've been coming to it for years, it's as good a beach hotel you'll get. (Which means, it's well used, no water pressure, obnoxious drunk people, and a parade of large people on summer vacation). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: mole11
Reviews.Content: terrible; terrible; terrible - very dirty; staff unprofessional; food stinks; stay in a tent and you will get better quality

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, clean, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: iestokes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about one block from the beach. It is pretty much on par with a Red Roof Inn, Econo Lodge, etc. If you are visiting Ocean City for the nightlife, I would recommend staying a little further down the same road (closer to the boardwalk) as we had trouble getting a cab to take us to the popular nightspots. There is a good spot to get breakfast right across the road, as well as some other restaurants and convenience stores close by. By far, the best part about the hotel is the close proximity to the beach, which is nicer and less crowded than it is closer to the boardwalk. Also, the pool is pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Mislead!!!”
Reviews.Author: jricks9
Reviews.Content: The amenities which were supposedly included were not. There was no coffee pot in the room as well as no wi-fi. When we confronted the front desk regarding the wi-fi, we were told the concrete was too thick and that is probably why we could not get access. The outlets in the bathroom did not work either. The room was nothing special. There are 3 elevators, but only one seemed to be working. Most likely will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: tcope83831
Reviews.Content: my stay was horrible, Shower had MOLD, food was left in hallway by another room door sitting on the floor for two days, the room had roaches, I did have my two small dogs with me and I was told when checking In that the dog floor was on the smoking floor only, (I am a non smoker) but later found out that there were dogs all threw out the building... This hotel needs a health inspection. ASAP I have tried calling to speak to the General manager since my stay, but I have had no response yet, it has been two weeks since my stay....Staff seems to be nice but not knowledgable to the General manager's information Like an email address? I pray nothing tragic would happen to this MOTEL, I wouldnt feel secure on staffs awarness..

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: PrashantJoge
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through am ex, however there was a glitch in the system and it didn't go through. Fortunately for me, I arrived at the hotel with the reservation email that am ex send me. The hotel honored the reservation and I was able to get my room at the same rate ($35/day). I traveled with my family of 2 toddlers and MIL. I thought the hotel was a steal. The room was very good (not foul smelling or shabby but spacious). The room service was excellent. The beach next door was really nice. For the price that I paid , It was everything that I expected an more (TV, microwave, Fridge) The pool was not bad either. Yes there are lots of kids and its not adult sized. The water seemed a little cloudy, but we didn't notice anything bad. The shower water pressure was good but the water to the tub was a little slow, but that was not a big concern for us.

Reviews.Title: “No Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: phillyhen
Reviews.Content: My wife found this hotel in a newspper add for a very reasonable rate for the last week before Labor Day. We agreed to give it a try since we only planned to sleep there and didn't need all the frills that we might have found somewhere else. Let me add that we were also travelling with two teenagers and two children under 10 yrs. old. We stayed at the Fenwick Inn for three nights this past August. We arrived at 12:00 PM and where told that they HAD NO ROOMS READY AND THAT WE COULD NOT CHECK IN BEFORE 4:00 PM. This was fine since we wanted to get some beach time in. I came back at 4:00 as I really wanted to unload the truck and get settled. Because they don't let anyone in before 4:00, there is a mad rush to get checked in. Be prepared to wait 40 minutes. Also a local police officer was leaving the hotel with a incident report while I was waiting to check in. Not the most encouraging beginning to a family vacation. Finally, I got our rooms and gathered the family who were waiting outside (no place to stand inside). We went up to the rooms and saw at least 5 trays of discarded room service food trays outside the rooms left over from breakfast. Since it was now closer to 5:00 PM, these should have been cleaned up already. The two rooms were OK. Each had a mini fridge and microwave. Both reeked of cigarettes even though they were supposedly "non-smoking" rooms. Pealing paint on ceiling as a result of water damage and carpet stains, but overall clean. I wouldn't want to spend any time in the room other to sleep and shower, but that was the expectation from the start. Bathroom was fine and clean. Not a lot of water pressure from shower but was warm. Also bring your own shampoo and soap. They do offer, but must be used sparingly. I wouldn't use the pool. When we walked by, there where probably 30 unsupervised kids in and out of the pool and hot tub likely creating swim conditions that would be less than favorable to get in concidering no one seemed to monitor pool. There was also a small arcade that my son enjoyed while waiting to check in. Hotel is close to the beach (one block), but you do have to cross Coastal Hwy. I ate at the restaurant on the top floor. Food was pricey for what you got and there are some funny discrepancies that can be found i.e. The chicken finger basket (chicken strips and french fries) is more expensive than if you order them seperately. Also, shrimp entree (1/2 lb. steamed shrimp with side and salad) was $10.00 more expensive than appetizer 1/2 lb. shrimp. I think $10.00 is excessive for house salad (bag mix) and side of (frozen) veggies. Overall, if you don't mind roughing it, the price is good at this hotel. However, I would spend an extra $30.00 / night and stay somewhere else given a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pickytravler_8
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living and always read reviews. This hotel is very mis judged. It is an older hotel that i have stayed at for about 10 years on and off. Although I have not stayed for about 5 years most current. Rooms were very clean, elevators were fast (3 elevators). THe down side is the check in. No One can check in a minute before 4:00. Other than that great stay, clean enough for my wife and young kids. Last thing, if you do read a bad review it was people staying on the 7th floor. Make sure you are not on this floor (smoking) The girl at the front desk said this is where they house construction workers for the most part that are in town for the week working

Reviews.Title: “This is our last year...”
Reviews.Author: mralph
Reviews.Content: For the last 5 years, our family has stayed at the Fenwick Inn for vacation. This will be our last year. The rooms are in such terrible shape! First, our ceiling was peeling and there was stains that looked like mold. These stains were in the room and in the bathroom. Second, there was blood or vomit stains on both of the beds box springs. They could have easily been covered up by a dust ruffle but I guess The Fenwick is so cheap they would rather their guests see all of the stains. Third, the bathrooms are disgusting! No recent updates in the past 10-20 years ( I guess)! The floor was dirty and there was hair on the walls. Toilet did not flush properly. You had to flush it 3 times for anything to go down. Lastly, don't even go into the pool. I wouldn't even allow my dog to swim in it. The only good things about the Fenwick is the price and how close it is to the beach. That is about it.

Reviews.Title: “Growing old, will waiting to check in”
Reviews.Author: jeshua1
Reviews.Content: Waiting for the 4:00 pm check in is horrible. They make you wait till the the clock strikes 4 on the dot. Then the mad rush to get to your room begins. SO expect to wait !. For the price that 's paid to stay in this place. A cheap continental Breakfast ( pastries ) would reduce the pressure on the wallet , for other things. Bobby flay need not be there to prepare a meal. The Bathtubs don't seem to empty out fast enough?. Can we get a bottle of drano at check in. The pool area is great for familes. But ?, does the filter system work? All the time I was there I could swear that it wasn't on? The roof top place to eat, pricy. A discount price should be offered to hotel guest. Now, for good eats just walk across the street to LEO'S and you won't be dissapointed on any meal. Nothing can be great. But overall this place was nice. I will stay again, BUT, I will follow some of the pointers in my own review.

Reviews.Title: “memorial day weekend”
Reviews.Author: grmnchk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple went to Ocean City over Memorial day Weekend. I have to say the room was not worth the money. The paint/texture of the ceiling was peeling and falling down. The bathtub was so stopped up that after 5 min of having the shower turned on, there were 5 inches of water in the tub. The tissue box in the bathroom was empty and wasn't filled until our last day there. Sunday brunch is a joke - the selection is not good enough for the amount of money that it costs. The only good thing they had was the bacon. I couldn't even get toast - all they had were dry biscuits. Overall, we were very disappointed. We will go back to Ocean City, but will never stay in that hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “not bad @ all”
Reviews.Author: JARWVU
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ the Fenwick Inn over Memorial weekend and it was a nice stay. I had not been there for over 5 yrs or longer but I thought the place was not bad @ all. I had read the reviews on here and I have to say some people must be pretty picky or just expect too much from the hotel. It is a old hotel but for the price($79/night) I paid it was a great deal. The room was not bad and yes some minor stains on the carpet but in general very clean. I do have a 5 yr old daughter so I am somewhat picky but found the room to be clean and spacious. The indoor pool was great and my daughter had a blast. I did not venture up to the rooftop restuarant but will recommend it since I have eaten @ it before and the view is very nice. SO, AS A PARENT I WILL RECOMMEND THE FENWICK INN IN TERMS OF GREAT PRICE, CLEANINESS, NICE POOL FOR KIDS, AND OVERALL GOOD EXPERIENCE. P.S.: THE FRONT DESK WAS VERY FRIENDLY.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly!”
Reviews.Author: Calvertgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel just smells horrible. They should have taken the money they put in the new pool and put it in the rooms. I am so glad I didn't have to stay any longer than the 12 hours I was there. The carpet is so dirty and nasty , glad I had my slippers with me. The hallways even smell very bad. Very Very outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Even For Free, Never, Never Stay At The Fenwick Inn Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: simmonsx6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my daughters cheer competition,with 15 other cheer families,dont make the same mistake!!When bedtime rolled around both of the beds were wet!!Under all 4 pillows and the pillows were wet,the headboard was warpped and the wall paper was peeling, which leads me to believe they knew about this.After unpacking for 5 people, we had to pack and move to another floor, which my 10 year old was hysterical about, leaving all the girls on the other floor.During the night another family moved since they had no hot water. I was given the managers card,left a voice mail,4 emails never got back to me!!I have never been treated so rudely.5 cars were broken into fri night and the police were back sat night due to rowdy guest,that the hotel couldnt handle(i dont blame them for that)For the manager not to respond that tells me they dont care.In all my travels this is the first bad review ive left.They said they would bring fans in to dry them, i guess they did because people were in it the next night,the box spring was DISGUSTING!!!Pay a few bucks more and stay somewhere safe and clean

Reviews.Title: “Dump Dump Dump! ! !”
Reviews.Author: redbones32
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I have never been to a hotel this bad in all my years of living. This hotel was recommended by my co-worker who had stayed at the Fenwick before. When my husband and I arrived we were given a king size smoking bedroom because they were out of the non smoking king rooms. When we got off the elevator the smell hit us in our face and it was bad. Once arriving at the hotel room door and opening it we were greeted by large stained carpet. The room was dark even after we turned on the lights. The couch had so many burn holes and look like it was on its last leg. The king size bed was terrible. The phone didn't work the paint was peeling from the ceiling and the drapes were falling down. We went back down to the front desk and asked for a double non smoking bedroom. It also had drapes falling down and paint peeling from the wall along with water damage to the ceiling throughout the room. It was just nasty! My co-worker and her husband had also came during the same weekend and they were also upset about there room. She said it use to be a nice hotel. We stayed there two nights and couldn't take it anymore and left early in the morning. The lobby area is even dark and dirty looking not to even get started on the little eating section they have near the front desk where they just through papers all over the floor. It really looks like a dump. I would not have stayed there but the other hotels were booked because there was a boat show that weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wise choice: don't stay at the Fenwick”
Reviews.Author: nik30j
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Ocean City for a weekend getaway. WE planned to stay at the Fenwick Inn. Luckily, we asked to see the room before agreeing to check in. When we walked in the "non-smoking" room, we both immediately smelled...something unpleasant. The room was dark & musty, & just looked disgusting. The view wasn't good, & the entire hotel was just horrible. The room, elevator (which was slow), & lobby were all dark, dank, & musty. We turned around immediately & told the man at the desk we would not stay there. His response?: "$89 a night, it's the cheapest rate in town." We didn't want cheap, we wanted nice!! That smell that is throughout the hotel: filth. It's what a disgusting, filthy house smells like if you don't clean it for years (or, at least that's what I'm guessing it would smell like). We did eat at the rooftop restaurant for the breakfast buffet. It's cheap, but that's about it. The food was so-so. We ate there a few years ago & liked it, but even the restaurant has gone downhill. It's dark & dirty, just like the hotel. One other thing: as we rode the elevator down to the lobby after breakfast, an employee got onto the elevator with us--he pushed a very large cart overflowing with filthy linens, towels, etc. I was offended by this; my husband & I had to push ourselves against the wall to make room for this huge cart. He needed to wait. Might sound petty, but that indicates the low level of "service" & the lack of caring of the staff there.

Reviews.Title: “Bright Spot on a spur of the moment trip”
Reviews.Author: jalapenopoe
Reviews.Content: I wasn't thrilled having to go to Ocean City off-season, but sometimes we can't exactly choose our destinations. The only good part of my trip was my stay at the Fenwick Inn. They are affordable (less than $60), the place was clean, and had a good restaurant right upstairs. I thought the staff was kind, and best of all it was quiet. I would highly reccomend this hotel and definitly appreciated its ease during an otherwise stressful business related two days.

Reviews.Title: “Such an enjoyable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OCForever
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel the front desk was very polite greeting my husband and I with smiles. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had requested a non smoking room, but after we checked in we realized we were in a smoking room. The front desk was very quick to accommodate us with a non smoking room, and helped us with our luggage. The restaurant in the hotel was wonderful! They had GREAT breakfast, very affordable. Another plus with the restaurant was the Happy Hour. They had several happy hour specials. My husband and I were very happy with this hotel and will stay with them again on our next trip to Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City's Finest DUMP”
Reviews.Author: ZmeisterJane
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that accepted dogs- came across the Fenwick Inn... sounded so appealing with it's new pool and restaurant, prices were excellent for the off season- this was going to be great. Wrong! We found our room with the number written in Sharpie across the door trim and the overwhelming smell of some kind of "mask the odor" sanatizer burned my nose hairs. Proceeding to turn on the lights we both stood there and stared at each other. Instead of the term wall to wall carpet, one could use wall to wall piss stain with the added bonus of a thousand and one cigarette burns. The mold up the wall was just an added bonus. I marched right downstairs and told the man working the desk that I'd like to see another room as I was not going to be sleeping in that room. His initial response was that he only charged us for 1 dog and not 2. My response was that I wouldn't let my dog sleep in that room. We got another key and went to see what lie behind door #2.... the same exact horror. Stench, mold, peeling wallpaper and wall to wall piss stained carpet. I looked in the phone book for the Clarion on 101st and asked if they had a room right now. They were more than accommodating, even though we spent twice as much money, we felt like we could relax and vacation in a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place We Ever Stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fenwick Inn last weekend, and I should say they should change the name to the Dirty Inn...Its a good thing its off season and the price is cheap and well you get what you pay for...We got check in, went to find our room, this was a bit hard since most of the Room numbers are missing off the door, and of course ours was one of them, so we had to guess we had found the right room..As we went into the room it was okay nothing special, 2 double beds, a tv with the remote having duc tape on the back to hold in the batteries..But be warn!!!! if you walk across the floor with your socks or even bare feet, the bottom will be black..the floor is dirty and gross..My family and I could not belive this..they really need to either shampoo the carpets or put new carpet in..So if you go make sure you bring your slippers!!..The bathroom needs updating as well. The only thing nice was the indoor pool other than that we will never stay there again..They really need to do an entire makeover on this place..and if you stay there during summer seaon and pay full price you are crazy!!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: LaRonda
Reviews.Content: I understand that peak season equals peak rates, however this hotel was just too expensive considering it's level of comfort and apperance. My family and I visited mid August when the rates are at their hightest. However it's just a basic hotel, with uncomfortable beds. If you're OK with just the basics and don't mind spending a few extra bucks, then I guess this would be the place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AprilConnors
Reviews.Content: The First room they put me and my family in was on the 7th floor. As soon as you got off the elevator you could smell this horrible stench. Our room didnt even have a number label on it, it was hand written in pen on the wall. Our room was horrible, it smelled like wet cats and pee, the wall paper was peeling off the wall and there was mold growing up. There were cigerette burns all over the carpet. The smell was so bad that I had to sleep in the car because I couldnt stand it. The next day they told us they would put us in another room which they did. That room was better however we came back that night very late only to find out thatour key wouldnt open the door. A lady came out of her room that was beside us and told us that they had given our room to someone else and there were people in our room while our stuff was in it. I had to stand in the hallway holding my sleeping child while my boyfriend went downstairs to find out what had happened and get us a key that would work. Thankfully nothing was stolen out of our room. The night time staff there is a joke. Daytime is a little bit better. I wouldnt stay at this hotel again if it was the only hotel left down there, I would drive home instead!!

Reviews.Title: “Forget This Place!”
Reviews.Author: AnnapolisGidget
Reviews.Content: The Fenwick needs to be completely renovated. And that includes the people at the front desk. No customer service! Forget about checking in early. We arrived 15 min. before check-in and were turned away, and told to come back after 4PM. And so we did, to find people waiting in lines stretched out the door. People and luggage all over the place with wet kids coming in from the pool dripping in the lobby. We waited 20 minutes to get checked in. It felt like I was at the airport! No kidding! The elevators are extremely slow and they use them to haul trash bins in and they stink at times. We paid an outrageous rate for our room; almost $300 per night, because we requested a king bed during peak season. The carpet was dirty with black moldy spots under the refrigerator that leaked. The bathroom had rusty spotting on the ceiling and around the tub. The room was outdated and old. The air conditioner did not get the room cool enough for me. And the bed spread was old and yucky with threads pulled on it as if a room full of cats had clawed on it. No plasma tv here! I was surprised that the room did not smell. I guess they order Fabreeze by the truck loads. The bar and restaurant were nice and offer a nice view. But really folks, take my advise and spend your $$$ elsewhere! I wish I had. PS-If you read "recently renovated", all that entailed, was them painting walls, and I believe they put new carpet in the hallways a year or two ago.

Reviews.Title: “Really wrong choice of hotel here!”
Reviews.Author: dboyer
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Fenwick Inn. The first time was 5 years ago and was nothing to write home about but we read on their website about all the improvements and remodeling, we decided to give another try. Great location. That's all the good I can say. We were told by someone on the phone to come early (check in time officially 4pm.) We arrived at 3:15pm and were abruptly told that we could not check in for at least an hour. No rooms were ready. I find that hard to believe but OK...We'd wait. My wife, 2 kids and I waited in the crowded, uncomfortable lobby. We explained that someone told us that we might be checked in early, the man at the counter was very snippy and showed his lack of concern. We finally get to our room. Room 626. After a second trip to the front desk to get the room keys re-programmed so we could get in, the room smelled of mold and as we turned down the bed we noticed a huge stain all over the box spring. It appeared to be blood. It also appeared as if these stains splashed up the wall...See pictures. Needless to say...we were not staying in this room. We then asked for another room, the hotel reluctantly obliged. We asked for the manager to come and look at the problem, we were told it would not be necessary. We then moved to our new room and heard someone from housekeeping going in the original room. We went to make sure they saw what we did. The lady from housekeeping said that there was no way that this was blood and made the bed up for the next unsuspecting customer. All this while another person from housekeeping was scrubbing the wall down. (Amazing - between 11am checkout and 4pm check in that these rooms could not be clean.) Our new room was also dirty and there was visible mold growing in the air conditioner, the pool was extremely cloudy, and not new. We had nowhere else to go and no concern from the hotel or management. We were never offered anything for our inconvenience nor did the manager ever contact us to see if everything was taken care of. I feel completely cheated by the Fenwick Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fenwick Inn Check-In a Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: voyageur54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fenwick Inn for a few days during the beginning of August. Most of our issues were outside the room though the lack of Internet connection in the room at this price range is pretty unacceptable. First, the check-in situation was a nightmare, since it is not staggered; long lines begin forming at 4 pm. Second, the lobby, being fairly small, could not always accomodate the lines, luggage carts, etc. Third, of the three passenger elevators, only one seemed to work, very slowly, and sometimes it shared space with odorous garbage bins. Finally, in the absence of a dress code, bathers from the in-door pool paraded through the lobby in all manner of dress and undress. I would not recommend the hotel at this price range.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe what you see in brochure pics and don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: WNJS
Reviews.Content: arrived at the fenwick inn at 3:15 pm, i was told by the middle aged male desk clerk the room would be ready within 15 to 20 minutes. i returned to the desk at 3:45 and was told the room is not ready yet. during the 30 minutes between 3:15 and 3:45 i too k a look around the property. first of all the furniture in the lobby (about three chairs and a love seat) left a lot to be desired as most of the upholstry was torn with the foam coming out. the lobby itself was dirty and had a bad smell. i looked at the pool area and it was filthy as well. in the back of the hotel was another parking lot, i noticed lots of thug types (maybe employees, maybe not) hanging around screaming and yelling). i decided at that time was not going to stay at this place. also while waiting for the room i noticed at least 30 parties arrive at the hotel to be told by each desk clerk that none of the rooms in the hotel would be ready until 4pm. i guess they had at least on housekeeper for every diirty room being cleaned at 3:30 pm that day. as soon as 4pm, they started checking people in as if every room got cleaned at the same time. not wanting to waste my day i was not about to spend another second in this place, so i put my luggage in my car and called to cancel my stay. they told me i had to pay for the first nights deposit. i told them i was not paying one penny as the hotel was not fairly or acurately represented on the internet or in print. they put me on hold for a minute and then told me i didn't have to pay any penalty. if they try charging me i will not stand for it and i will seek legal action. this hotel is one of the worst ever. why lie to people? why not let a person check in if the room is clean? why make people wait until 4pm, if the room is clean 15 minutes earlier? why not be truethful in advertising your hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: milf34
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fenwick Inn every summer for the past 3 years and had another great experience. We arrived at 10 am and were able to check in that early with no extra charge. Had a very clean room with no peeling wallpaper and the bathroom in excellent condition. There is brand new carpeting in the halls of the 6th floor and I think new wallpaper as well. Not sure of the other floors updating. A/C worked very well and had a great view of the ocean. Our children love the pool, though it is somewhat sandy--you are at the beach and this is to be expected. This area is great to stay with or without children. Would definately recommend this hotel especially for the inexpensive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Fenwick”
Reviews.Author: niffer110
Reviews.Content: I rented this room online just days before heading to Ocean City, MD for vacation. Our party consisted of two adults (parents) and two children, ages 8 and nearly 2. Immediately upon entering the room, I was very impressed. The cleanliness and size of the room was excellent. We had a small fridge and microwave in our room. While the view was not breath-taking, the window was huge and the view was not at all bad. All interactions with staff were positive. This hotel is just a block away from the beach. We all enjoyed the indoor pool (despite its being littered with sand). It was well worth the money! I would definitely stay here again, as well as recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Having a 2-Day Reservation (per hotel policy) Meant Nothing. RUDE Staff.”
Reviews.Author: DivaRnr
Reviews.Content: My hotel REQUIRED Friday & Saturday night minimum reservation ended up being worthless and costing me $86.11. Because I had no need to be in O.C. Friday, but had a reservation for Friday & Saturday, I didn't arrive to the hotel until Saturday late morning. I went to check in and was told that my "Friday & Saturday minimum per hotel policy for the weekend reservation" was automatically turned into a no-show and my room was sold for Saturday. I'm still trying to figure that one out - kinda goes against their own policy, don't ya think? Amber was extremely rude. The hotel was dirty. The location at the top of the strip is out of the way. Don't ever stay here. It may be one of the cheaper hotels in the area, but at Fenwick, you get what you pay for. In my case - nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra for elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: laughing808
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Oceacn City, where we stayed at the Fenwick Inn. This was our second time staying there. This visit the TV cable programming didn't work, and the maintenance man couldn't figured out the problem. He actually reprogrammed the TV twice to no avail!!! So supposedly that swapped out the TV for another one. Cool fine, on to the next problem. The rooms come equipped with a mini fridge and microwave. Nice, but shouldn't they work properly???? The microwave only worked on the popcorn setting. The decor was abit outdated and I actually saw wallpaper peeling away. Overall, you get what you pay for. For 2 nights stay and a food voucher not bad for the price. But, next time we'll spend the extra bucks to stay at a more reputable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They check in, but they don't check out....literally”
Reviews.Author: Ammie805
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here this past weeked (8/18-8/20) because we decided last minute to take a trip down to OC from Long Island and everything was sold out (although driving back from the boardwalk I would see nicer hotels along the strip and "vacancy" flashing). My impression of the lobby was eh, nothing spectacular. The elevators are old and worn and slow. The room is big, comfortable and it was remodeled (again, nothing spectacular) though the bathroom needs some major remodeling work. I hate to admit it but my bed was really comfortable! The room decor is ok, nothing spectacular. But the most memorable part of my stay was the cockroach in the bathroom. I got up in the middle of the night to, well...you know... and there it was crawling on the counter. I have traveled and stayed at numerous places the past 5 years and never have I encountered a cockroach. I don't care if the hotel is old or new. To me, a roach is gross and I don't want to have to stay in a place that has them! The restaurant upstairs wasn't bad. I only had breakfast (sit down). I also had the breakfast buffet which I wasn't impressed with, but that's me. I don't care for buffets. Another downside to the hotel is the location. The traffic is unbearable to the boardwalk. It probably was better to use the bus but we like to drive. The beach access is across the street but we haven't gone. For what we paid, we could have gotten a closer hotel to the boardwalk. Definitely not work $269 a night (which was what we paid). I could have had a room at the Dunes Manor Hotel close to the boardwalk for the same price but by the time I went back to reserve it was sold out. I was not impressed with OC. I guess because I have beaches here. I really need to visit Montauk.

Reviews.Title: “nice large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Farmerjoe
Reviews.Content: Over the 4th of July we stayed at Fenwick Inn in Ocean city MD. My only disappointment with this hotel was the fact that you had to cross the Coastal Highway to get to the beach everyday. The staff was very friendly and even the maids were nice and willing to talk to you if you ask them a question, most of them spoke French but had very good English to convey a message. They had a n indoor pool with a little mushroom fountain which the kids loved. They also had sprinklers the kids could move around like a squirt gun on the sides of the pool. The adults could enjoy their large hot tub which was quite hot. The rooms were large, and you can get street view or bay view from the back if you are up high enough, We could see a little of the ocean from the 5th floor facing the Coastal highway. Parking was easy. We saw at least 5 wrecks when we were there on the Coastal Highway, I would recommend this hotel for people with older kids who can cross a busy highway safely but if you have little ones i would stay on the Ocean Block Side. This hotel runs about 119.00 with a aaa discount a night. it also has a lounge area vending machine room and arcade games. The hotel is much older than alot of Ocean City's hotels but it is spacious. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away unless you're a drunken high school/college student”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back. For $120, we got a dirty, run down, and UNREMODELED place. The sign said remodeled rooms. The bathtub did not drain, there was a smell of mildew and mold, the pool/hottub totally gross. The air conditioning/air ventilation system must have high mold/mildew concentration. I am sick now. There was drunken teenagers/college kids partying and trashing the place. I can't believe AAA gave this place a two-star rating. Unbelievable. I saw the pictures on this and other websites. I was fooled. I have travelled alot and I will for now on stay only in familiar named hotels, i.e. Comfort Inn, or Holiday Inn. Stay away from privately owned establishments unless you personnally know someone who has stayed there. Ocean City Maryland is such a rip off anyways but it's the closest for a beach weekend. Just be wary of any lodging/resturant in Ocean City Maryland. I wish we stayed home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for a weekend at the beach”
Reviews.Author: catwomyn
Reviews.Content: For a weekend in Ocean City, this place is just fine. We had a nice, comfortable, king size bed in our room, the AC worked great and the bed was far enough from the door that we didn't hear too much noise from the hallway (which we appreciated on one night when a group of drunken young women down the hall carried on until the wee hours). The first time we used the shower, it didn't drain very well, but the problem was fixed after we complained to the front desk. The room was cleaned very well each day. The restaurant (Jordan's) is decent -- very reasonable prices, okay service (nothing spectacular, mind you, but what do you expect from a bunch of kids working there for the summer?). It's very convenient and you won't get food poisoning. You have to go across the street to get to the beach, but that wasn't a big deal for us. There is plenty of free parking on-site and although you're a bit removed from downtown, that's what your car or the city bus is for. For the rate, I thought it was just fine and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Anyone with hotel experience will be very disappointed. I read the other reviews before we stayed, some good, some bad, so I gave the benefit of the doubt as a generally tolerant soul. Well, now I believe the other bad reviews, and the good ones must be anomalies. Where do I start: On arrival at 5 pm Sunday, there was a very long check-in line, into the parking lot, about an hour wait. The AAA tour book states a special feature is early check-ins & late checkouts, in reality, no way, they refused any check-in's prior to 4pm. At check-in, right in front of the lobby desk, a woman & man with a baby in stroller next to us, decided to open a case of beer & start chugging together while waiting, then spilling beer all over the floor including the stroller, nothing cleaned. Nice family atmosphere. The room was stinky, moldy, carpet nasty; we had to stay, & figured other rooms were worse, so cleaned & sprayed with a whole can of Lysol. The A/C was filthy, stunk, loud, and leaked condensation to soak the carpet, don't wear any socks. A drip from outside, the room a/c above, dripped on the metal windowsill like water torture all night. The windows do not open so forget any fresh air. The refrig had to be unplugged at night due to noise. The elevators were very slow, or did not work, stairs were a must, and the stairways sometimes had foul odors of urine or wacky tobacco. The pool seemed okay except we couldnt see through the water so we refrained. Jackhammer construction across the street for wake up calls. Extremely busy highway to cross to beach, unreal, like a major inner city loop, not safe for kids or unaware adults. If you are paying even $99 per night expect something better than tenement housing. Camping would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fenwick before, and were not overly impressed, but decided to give it a try as it posted as being "remodelled". We checked in and dressed to go out to dinner, and as we were leaving our room, noticed that the light fixture in front of our door in the hallway was On Fire!!! We broke the glass to the fire alarm and pulled it. We walked down, and the front desk told us (and others) they did not know if it was a fire or not. We assured them the wall was on fire, and to have people leave! Outside, people were complaining about how long it took to check in, bad service, and some, who were eating in the restaurant above the 7th floor (fire area) were told to continue eating. When I questioned the manager about this the next day, she said that the alarms go off all the time from the kitchen, so how would they really know? People were using the elevator to go down while the alarm was going off. The fire Marshall was not impressed with the hotel. Another comment was "you get what you pay for".The front desk was not helpful and only when pressed offered us 30 dollars off one night at the hotel for "helping out". They were not polite. I also questioned paying for a room that was Very noisy until 1:00 a.m. and she said were were told it was right under the restaurant/bar. I told her was had not been told this, and she said her staff wrote it in the comments, so it was true. I demanded another room for our second (and last ever night there) and they moved us. (again not a renovated room) Our frig did not work in the first room, and many electrical wires pug into a powerbar in each room. The clock radio flickered on and off if you moved it. I questioned being charged for a frig when it did not work, and she said we informed the wrong staff (no apologies) about the frig. We had to make 4 calls, spanning 1 1/2 hours for some extra blankets. Service sucks here, and the renovated rooms were no where to be seen.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Fenwick!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Fenwick Inn with a group of 100 for a convention. The hotel was chosen because all other hotels in MD were sold out. Now I know why the Fenwick was available!! This hotel was fair at best. It is very tired and in desperate need of renovation. The hotel pool area was very poorly lighted, probably so that you could not notice that you could not see anything in the water past your waist. The pool towels were as big as hand towels and washed so many times you could see through them. When we checked into our room we found the room to have stains on the ceiling, dirty carpets and the blanket on the bed was soiled. When I called down to the front desk, I was told that I would have to wait my turn behind other guests because they had a long list and only one maid for fresh linens. Since it was 10:30 p.m. already, and I didn't want to wait any longer, I told her to please drop the sheets and blankets off so that I could make my own bed. After two phone calls, the sheets did arrive, but no blanket. When I asked the maid for a blanket she told me they had no more left. It makes you wonder how often the blankets are ever changed and washed if there is only one for each room. We had a sleeping bag in our car and used that for the weekend, since the blanket never showed up the next day either. Although the Jordon Roof Top restaurant is located in the hotel, we were told it was not affiliated with the hotel when my husband inquired at the desk to have the room service breakfast dishes removed from in front of the elevator area on the 4th floor at 8:00 p.m. Since the restaurant doesn't belong to the hotel, I don't know if the hotel can be blamed for this one or not, but another woman in our group ordered the lobster for room service and ended up spending the evening in the local hospital for food poisoning. Others in our group had many complaints as well, including only 2 of the 3 elevators working, only two luggage carts for hotel, dirty rooms, etc. Our group does plan on attending this same convention again in MD next year, but if we can not get 100 rooms all in the same hotel we will probably split up in lieu of staying at the Fenwick. No one in our group plans on going back to the Fenwick. However, when we checked out, they did take $20.00 off our room for it being dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not happy at all with the Fenwick- the website makes it look nice. I spent two nights there with my daughter for a cheerleading competition. My room smelled like smoke so much that I had to move twice.. At first they weren't even going to move me because they said they were sold out and when I said my eyes were burning from the smoke smell they said " that's a non-smoking floor"- but finally offered me another room. The bathroom was not clean and the room had a hole in the corner of the ceiling from water leaks. The pool was so questionable looking the girls on the team wouldn't even swim in it. The elevators in the building did not work properly and were also dirty- they took so long to get anywhere most people were using the stairwell. I would not recommend the Fenwick to anyone. I was so glad to check out.
